Reviews.Title: “Great location to see Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Sue53449 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, with easy access to central Rome. Room did not have couch or easy chairs. Made relaxing in room a bit difficult. But we would still stay here because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “More hype than substance”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireGladders
Reviews.Content: I guess Rome is a notoriously expensive city particularly around the tourist areas. However, this was a special occasion and so I chose a hotel that I thought would be relatively handy for sightseeing and not what I would describe as cheap. Just to make sure, I booked a 'Junior Suite' at a cost of £528 for three nights. Reception looked promising, check in was dealt with pleasantly and we were shown to our room by a porter who looked after our luggage. The 'Junior Suite' consisted of a long corridor leading into an ante room containing a wardrobe and a couple of chaise long.......guess this was the 'suite' part of the deal. The ante/dressing room was separated from the bed room by a floor to ceiling, sliding, wooden framed, glazed partition. A couple of panes of rectangular, coloured glass were missing.........no doubt one of the previous heavy handed tourists. The bed room was pleasant and the whole place was furnished in the 'faux antique' style. Repro, distressed pieces of furniture that played their part as long as you didn't look too close. Off the bedroom was a small 'utility' space for getting luggage out from underfoot, quite useful. Also off the bedroom was the bathroom. Real marble this time but to be frank, not very well done. The bathroom was satisfactory containing a toilet, a bidet, wash hand basin and a spa bath/shower with a fully glazed screen. Unfortunately, after having tried the spa bath and its not very convincing water jets, water began to appear from under the bath and gradually spread behind the toilet and bidet, almost to the door. We put down the shower mat to stop the water going any further and reported the issue to the front desk. They promised to get someone to look at it . True to their word, someone had be in and re-sealed the obvious joints round the bath with silicon. When we next checked .......you guessed it, water was seeping out from under the bath. We told Reception as we checked out. We could have had a transfer to the airport arranged by the hotel but I couldn't see why we needed to pay 10 euros more than getting a taxi from the taxi rank one minutes walk away. We weren't able to eat in the hotel other than breakfast. This was probably the highlight of our stay at the Romanico. It was taken in the roof top breakfast area and gave an impressive view of the roof tops of Rome...........if roof tops are your thing. It was actually very pleasant, as was the buffet breakfast. The seating areas around the bar were pleasant but the bar prices were not. We actually found another hotel (name of which I can't remember, sorry) with a 'Blue Bar' which was much more reasonable and provided us not only with drinks but olives and other nibbles as a part of the service..............for considerably less than our own hotel. Don't forget you will have to pay the government 'visitor tax' prior to departure....not a lot but embarassing if you're down to just your airport taxi fare having spent all your euros on two liquers from the hotel bar!! The overall experience wasn't unpleasant but I definitely expected more, and won't be rushing back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, good location.”
Reviews.Author: nats-dk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in a triple room. Good service, good location, could easily walk everywhere. The rooms were very clean with nice decor. Nice bathroom and good shower. Good value for money, considering the price we paid. A little tip when booking: go online and spend some time checking the prices. Hotel itself wanted 1300euro for 4 nights in a triple room, booking.com was 1200euro. In the end we got it for 550 British pounds! We booked through lastminute.com.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: rans_travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of our 2 week trip in Italy. We were traveling with young children 10 & 12 and we had two rooms on the second floor. The rooms were spacious and the bathrooms were newly renovated and extremely clean and nice. We were very anxious after booking, as we had read previous negative reviews about the hotel, but were pleasantly surprised!! We arrived at 8 am by an early morning flight and they gave us one room by 11 am as a courtesy. We were concerned as we had heard horror stories about stolen stuff, but our stuff was secure and the hotel was very decent. The front desk was polite enough (though they did not go out of their way to help) and messed up our reservations to the Borghese Gallery. The location of the hotel was excellent and they even stored a bag for us to 7 days free of charge during our trip to Florence and Amalfi. Overall a good hotel and very well located.

Reviews.Title: “romanico palace rome italy”
Reviews.Author: Paula L
Reviews.Content: the hotel was clean service was excellent without the front desk person Giuglio and his advice and help our trip would not have been so enjoyable His English was impeccable and made our vacation so much easier. He was eager to help kind and friendly. The only downside there was no restaurant or room service I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kerry W
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in Romanico palace and spa! Upgraded the room to the suite, was excellent, great view and hot tub on balcony. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Only down side was that there is no restaurant in the hotel, However the breakfast served on the roof terrace was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Maxime G
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights. I was worried about previous comments but everything was good. The reception was nice. Our room was on the patio side, I would suggest the street side to have more sun. The room was not huge but enough for 3 days. The bathroom was clean. The breakfast was served on the roof terrace, where the view is great. It's nice to start the day with light and sun. I was expecting more choices for the breakfast, but what was presented was ok. The location of the hotel is really handy, everything is accesible by walk quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Everything OK, but the best the personal”
Reviews.Author: Helen T
Reviews.Content: I was with some friends in the hotel, spending a few days of vacations and everything was wonderfull. The rooms are nice and the location is very good, but the best of all was the personal of the recepcion, in specially a girl called Daniela (i don´t remember the surname). She was very friendly and helpfull with us. Thanks of her we do some trips around de city very interestings, she help us with everything, who to move in Rome, the best places to visit, two very good restaurants... al always with a big smile. How nice is find people like her in other countries. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Once again a lovely clean hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TLC61
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last year and once again this year it was as clean and friendly as I remembered. My friend, sisters and I had 2 twin rooms booked and they were very pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The hotel is a reasonably short walk from the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain and the bus stop/tour bus is a stones throw from the hotel. We were a bit puzzled about some bad reviews we had seen on Trip Advisor because we had a great experience, the rooms were very clean and the staff were very helpful. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant deal, lovely, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: KazandGaz61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Romancio Palace Hotel in January 2012, we had a brilliant deal as we contacted the hotel direct. Our room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. We slept well, but we had been walking for the whole weekend. Breakfast was sufficient, and would recommend as an upgrade. Hotel within easy walking distance to main sites, and if not taxis were a plenty. Hotel staff were very friendly, especially the night staff.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Zoe891
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here I was a little concerned about our trip to Rome and the Romanica Palace but I was not dissapointed. The hotel was wonderful. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful, the rooms were luxurious and exceptionally clean and the location was excellent (within walking distance of most of the main attractions). We didn't stay for breakfast or use the spa facilities but that was because Rome is such a beautiful city that there was far more to see and do out and about!

Reviews.Title: “4 star??????? - Pah!”
Reviews.Author: amber m
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand how people have rated this hotel so highly. We thought it was a complete joke! The location was good and all the staff were lovely and friendly and very helpful - but I am afraid that this is where the good points end! If it wasn't for these points, we would have been plain miserable. On arrival, we were offered an upgrade to "the best room in the house" for an extra £50 per night - we agreed and were very excited - until we got to the room. If that was the best room in the house, I'd hate to have seen the bog-standard rooms! The paint on the walls was falling off, the TV didn't work (and was never fixed) and it just looked generally a bit shabby and dilapidated. The website says it has been recently refurbed, a big selling point for us, but we did not see any evidence of this at all.The shower was an awkward unsatisfying dribble and the products provided were decidedly 2 star rather than 4. Just so u know, I have never felt compelled to write a review of a hotel before but this hotel was so blatantly not a 4 star. By far the worse part was the breakfast which did not consist of barely anything! There was gross bimbo style bread (the type you get in spain when yr desperate), 3 types of anemic looking cereals (all gross), dry croissant things, some cake, yoghurts, cheese and ham (all poor quality), no fruit at all unless u begged and they reluctantly bought you out a bit- it reminded me of the sort of continental breakfast you suffered on school trips - not when paying premium rates for a supposed 4 star hotel. I could bang on about this hotel for ages, but I'll spare you all the details - just one other point. When snowed in with the freakish weather of last week in Rome, we tried to order from their in-room menu for room-service. We were told that the hotel does not have a restaurant and that one can only order drinks. The website is extremely misleading as it states there is a restaurant on the roof as is the in-room menu which teases u with food you cannot order (the menu is actually for a restaurant up the road). Insult was added to injury when we spotted a laminated notice with the menu saying that guests are not permitted to bring in food from outside the hotel into their rooms! Absolutely ridiculous especially given they do not offer any food for their guests themselves! I will end this by saying that the spa is average, badly organised and the steam room smells of B.O. We are judging this hotel by its star rating which it does not even slightly deserve and thereby we give it 2 points - simply for the lovely staff and good location. Don't bother guys xxx

Reviews.Title: “We were sent to a different hotel after arrival!”
Reviews.Author: Jitka2506
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel and were very excited about going to Rome. We got to Rome early in the morning, and could not check in so we arrived to the hotel to drop off our luggages and went for a walk. Nobody said there was a problem. After walking through whole Rome, we came back to the hotel about 5pm, absolutely exhausted. We were then told at the reception, that they could only accomodate us for one night... The explanation was that their booking system has fell and they lost part of the information - apparently this is used by many hotels as they try to book as many guests in as possible. We were so tired we didn't even argue because they showed us a location of the other hotel and ask us, if we wanted to stay for one night and then move again, or go to this substitute hotel there right away. Of cource we agreed. This new hotel was also supposed to be in the historic area, close to Colosseum. They paid for a taxi to drive us there. We couldn't believe when we entered this new hotel. Is was also 4star hotel, but hardly 2 stars in reality. Unfortunately, this ruin the whole Rome experience for us. We complained about it after we got back to UK and got one night refund back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lourdes l
Reviews.Content: I booked Romanico Palace looking for location and price. After viewing the reviews I was a little concern about the service and rooms, however I have to say that our experience was exceptional. Our room in the 5 floor (521 and 519)were perfect, clean neat and very Roman. The furniture was beautiful and in perfect conditions, the bathroom was majestic (not one tile missing) very nice shower, hot water at all the times, soft white towels and even the toilet paper smelled good . The employees were extremely helpful and very nice,every recommendation regarding tours and restaurants were perfect, Daniela the concierge was great. The area extremely safe we walked at all hours of the night. The maid found one of my pearl earring and left it in my night stand (very honest employee). The only area that needs improvement in my taste would be the breakfast (more variety) I would give that beautiful terrace more use, the view is incredible. Do not go to the next door restaurant 2 croissants/ 2 coffees ***15 euros***next day we went to a bar in the corner, the same order *** 6 euros. Remember rooms in Europe are not comparable in size to the ones in U.S. Lourdes and Carlos Gonzalez

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Romanico is very baroque and gold and gawdy but nice”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworldcs
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and booked at a reasonable price. Located near the American Embassy and out of the chaos of the other areas. Fabulous shower and tub (sunken). Room is comfortable. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: morrisjanita
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of our Italian tour. Found the hotel to be in a trendy, expensive, safe location. Didn't have to worry about where we were though, as our tour took us everwhere. The hotel itself was clean, typically small european rooms, with nice high ceilings. Breakfast was on the top floor of hotel, which offered a fantastic view over the city. Selection was really good, but I think eggs were only offered to us as we were with a tour. Great coffee, pastries, fruit etc. Staff were generally nice.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely return if possible”
Reviews.Author: Musicianontheroad
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Romanico was wonderful. Our room was clean and much more spacious than we expected in a European hotel - really comparable to what you would expect in an American hotel. The decor in our room was lovely. Our bathroom had this amazing shower with multiple jets and a shower head the size of a dinner plate! The concierges were unfailingly polite and helpful. The bartender even made me an icepack after I had an accident (NOT at the hotel) and needed to ice down my bruises. The location of this hotel is excellent; it is within easy walking distance of the Termini train station, but in a much cleaner, safer-feeling neighborhood. We walked all around that hotel at all hours, shopping and eating, and we enjoyed every minute. The only things I didn't like about this hotel: their breakfast was much overpriced for what was offered, not to mention that all the items that should have been cold (dairy, meat, etc.) were lukewarm, yuck. And the bed and pillows in our room were extremely firm, too much so for my taste. But overall, this is a great place to stay in Rome. I dearly hope to return again someday.

Reviews.Title: “The lovely Romanico Palace!”
Reviews.Author: MissSally2
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night here, and though the room was small, it was quite lovely. We had a darling terrace and the bed was really, really comfortable, and the shower..well, it was totally luxe, one of those many-spigoted showers. The price was good, room was clean and bright, and the location was great, right near the Via Veneto, and we had the best meal of our trip-possibly our lives!-around the corner in a charming little family-owned place called Ristorante La Fontenella. Best cannoli ever! The Romanico staff was wonderful and helpful, and we would definitely stay there again. Thanks, Romanico!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Mariposa17
Reviews.Content: What a lovely, old fashioned hotel... the staff coudlnt do enough for you and very friendly.. its worth taking an upgrade for a great room with a jacuzzi in your room. very central to everything and easy bus/metro access. Would definetly go back again

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Thieves from hotel room safe "STAY AWAY"”
Reviews.Author: finedk
Reviews.Content: Thanks to my friend "WizOfOzCP" which quickly got our warning sent out on Tripadvisor. My wife and I visited the Hotel Romanico Palace from 15 November 2011 to 22 November 2011. This was an extremely horrible experience and I would therefore like to warn others against using Hotel Romanico Palace. We arrived at the hotel late afternoon on 15 November and was assigned room "118 of the hotel employees, who also made us clear that the hotel room safe was safe to use. We were at a four star hotel, so we chose to follow the hotel instructions. This would prove to be extremely unwise. As we left the hotel room on November 16, we had placed our valuables there among 700EU, before we left the room I entered my pin code no indication either in the passport or elsewhere, while locked my wife both closets, which hotel Safe is located. When we came back again towards the evening, my wife noticed that the closets were not locked anymore, we wondered what caused the hotel staff would have to open our closets. But as things in the closets so untouched out, it was at our amazement. We had not yet opened our safe. Next morning on November 17th when we would leave the room, we opened the hotel safe box and quickly realized that 300EU missing from our wallet. As we remember our amazement from the evening before, we were aware that someone had gained access to our hotel safe and a stolen 300EU. When something like that happens you will always be in doubt, maybe you have made a mistake or you have forgotten to locked the safe box, because you are on a four stars hotel, there is video surveillance and electric door control. If there had been thieves in our hotel room, the reception would let us know. ect. We decided not to say anything at the reception, but to take all our valuables with us, and before we left the room, we mark the hotel safe box so that we outside could see if anyone had been inside the box while we were away from the hotel room. We locked our closets and marked them so it was possible to see if the closets had been opened. When we got back in the evening, we could fast see that our closets had been opened, while we were marking the hotel safe box had been broken. There was no doubt their had been thieves at our hotel room. We approached the front desk and told about the theft, which promised to control the electric door locks and video surveillance. At the same time the receptionist informed that this had never happened before in the hotel, and that all employees were trusted employee who had been there for many years. Yet I decided to "google" hotel on the internet, and soon I found here on Tripadvisor a similar incident in March 2010 when an American family had been stolen 200USD. I took my computer with me down to reception and asked them to explain why they not informed about this review on Tripadvisor. The receptionist told me that he knew nothing about the incident, and after reading it, shaking his head and laughed. I told the receptionist that I could not see anything funny in being robbed when you were a guest at Hotel Romanico Palace, and that their safety should be taken seriously. Then the receptionist offered me a cup of coffee in the hotel bar, which I refused. Subsequently day on November 18 we went to the police to report the thieves. In addition to notification and a receipt, the police would not do anything in the case, we called the police to visit the Hotel Romanico Palace, but the distance to the hotel at 50m seemed insurmountable for the officer. When we got back to the hotel we asked the front desk how it went with the investigation. The receptionist who was the same I had spoken with the evening before, could tell that there was nothing to see on video surveillance as well as on the electronic door lock. So no one had been in our room besides cleaning staff. And it was not possible to open the hotel safe box without the pin code which I had used. Hotel Romanico Palace had no boss (manager) key for the hotel safe box and therefore had no access to the hotel safe box: told the receptionist. In that case of the American family, where the hotel receptionist had used a manager key for the hotel safe box, could not be true. It was therefore concluded that my wife and I stood there and lied and we could not have been robbed. My augment with evidence that someone from the hotel had acquired departure for the hotel safe box would not fit. Simultaneously, reception's ability to understand english very bad, actually it was no longer possible to communicate understandably with the reception. The next day when we stayed at the hotel, I tried to obtain further information about Hotel Romanico Palace, hotel safe box, I found that on the back of the safe box was given a service code COD # 20696, as a handheld terminal or a PC via a USB connector on the underside of the keypad on the safe box, could provided access to the SETUP menu on the safe box, and thereby provided access to the information entered. The "Italian" reception at the hotel could tell that this was only used by the company that had service on the hotel safe box, and that they had no sense of anything like that. And this was it indeed be true when they say so. After I came back from Rome, I found this on Youtube, it proves that at 50 Laptop Safe box, only need a paper clip, a 9 volt battery, and 2 min, then the box emptied of value. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=99Q3aDy-BUc Apart from all hassles with Hotel Romanico Palace, had my wife and I a wonderful trip to Rome, a few pleasant days in each other's company with beautiful weather and fun. It remains only to ask yourselves: Why do guests on Hotel Romanico Palace get their money stolen. ? Why have Hotel Romanico Palace none trust to the complaints ? Why should hotel Romanico Palace lie of past events. ? Why was it not possible to see the video surveillance at the hotel. ? Why was it not possible to see the printout from the electronic door lock at the hotel. ? Why do we repeatedly see the receptionist speak in walkie-talkie outside the hotel. ? Why do thieves not only take 20EU 50EU and it will probably never be discover, or maybe that is the reason why there have been so few complaints. ? I must commend the cleaning, it was good, you can say too good. I really can not recommend visiting Hotel Romanico Palace, we welcome all our holidays with our wife, family, children and friends. A nightmare with theft from a hotel safe, a hotel and police are neglecting your review. That movie can we see Saturday night on the television. The holiday must be peaceful and romantic. "Travelling is living" Quote: Hans Christian Andersen (H.C Andersen anno 1855) Martin (Denmark)

Reviews.Title: “No excuses - just plain bad”
Reviews.Author: giugitzu79
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a romantic weekend in beautiful Rome - I am Italian and I have to say I have rarely ever seen such bad service in an Italian hotel, which are normally very good. This is not a four star hotel. We got there and half of the hotel had no hot water (my room included) - I had a cold and needed a hot bath, I protested at 2pm on Thursday and again on Friday several times. They changed story every day with a different excuse, it was plain obvious they were just trying to buy time, this is inexcusable and the management should really be replaced. The last straw was Friday coming back at midnight having been told before leaving that hot water would be back in 40 minutes time (this was at 9pm) and find no hot water still. I packed everything and went to reception saying they either deal with it or I am leaving and we want our money back also for the last night which we would certainly not spend there. Somehow magically, at 1am we are given another room on the other side of hotel with hot water (however, been downgraded with a horrible bathroom with mold). I say I still want my money back for this and I am told "you have to wait for the morning to speak to management". Fine, we go to sleep and early morning my husband goes down and he is now told "management is abroad" (!!) and we cannot give you money back because the booking was via lastminute.com. We then had to call lastminute (extremely helpful) who got on the phone with the hotel manager (there is one now apparently, funny that). After that we get call and offered many apologies and offered to spen our last night in an executive suite - this is our third room in 3 nights. In a nuthsell, too little and way too late and this hotel needs badly a change of management and to train their empliyees not to tell lies to angry customers. I only went to reception downstairs 5-6 times during our stay and every single time there was someone complaining (and I can confirm the safe incident as I was there when the gentleman and his wife made them aware of what happened in their room - appalling). Do not book here until some changes are in place.

Reviews.Title: “nice enough”
Reviews.Author: AnanB
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we were told that we were being 'upgraded' to a room in a different building. This was a hassle to get to but the room was lovely and big, no view but it was clean. The bath was meant to be a jacuzzi bath but wasn't and the air conditioning didn't work. On the third day we arrived back and couldn't get into our room so we had to go down to reception (in the other building) to be told that we were being moved because of works in our building. The second room in the main building was not as nice as the first one - smaller and darker but with a better view. Still the air conditioning wasn't working and the hotel was hot. Breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: scqs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for two nights recently. The service from the front desk was excellent. They were friendly and very helpful. The room we stayed was dated and definitely needed some sprucing up. There were cracks on the ceiling and part of the ceiling were not painted, possibly due to earlier repair works. The window shutters could not be latched - there was no way to keep the shutters shut when the wind blew. The elevator was extremely slow and did not seem to work well - it took a long while for the door to open. We liked the hotel's location.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: soleneve_11 Posted by a Volagratis traveler
Reviews.Content: we liked the hotel, the location, the kindness, the nearby trattoria La Lanterna. Good price and good room! Walking distance from the most interesting sites, good transportation by subway, the weather was perfect, the carpet at the hotel had some stains. Do not have breakfast at the hotel because it is expensive, you can walk to piazza repubblica and have a good cappuccino and croissant there for a low price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Introduction to Tour”
Reviews.Author: GotaGo2Da
Reviews.Content: Our stay was the first 2 nights of our Insight Vacation. It's in a business district and it was the weekend. The area was perfect for strolling and very quiet and safe. I'm sure during the week it's a lot more busy. Atm's and a few restaurants are close by.. The front desk suggested a restaurant and it was VERY good.The room was clean and fun, with a high ceiling and overdone furnishings. Breakfast is upstairs in a glass enclosed porch overlooking 3 views of Rome...beautiful in the morning ! Nice place with nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - location a bit quiet”
Reviews.Author: Sonali M
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel a day after Rome had suffered from terrible storms to find that our room was not available, the hotel had 12 rooms out of action. They arranged for us to be taken to an alternative hotel for the night and paid for our taxi fair too. We got to the alternative hotel and it was appalling - immediately called the Romanico Palace to complain and they arranged and paid for a taxi back and accomodated us into the room we originally booked which was great - very clean, beautifully decorated, a little small but robes, slippers all provided. The room service was exceptional - nothing was too much trouble for the staff and all needs were attended to quickly. Especially Mauritzio who was an excellent host and very helpful about any queries we had - he definitely went over and above for us. The negative points are that internet access is 5 euros/hour which is quite high - though reception gave us a couple of cards for free which was kind. The breakfast is not worth paying for - there is a basic selection of meat, cheese, cereal and bread (which is hard) eggs and orange juice are charged at about 10 euros extra which seems a little odd for a 4* hotel. The location is the priciest area of Rome - restaurants are very pricey and close at odd times so finding food can be awkward. The main tourist attractions are close and a bus/metro is very cheap and right outside the hotel so access is easy. We would definitely return to the hotel based on it's service however the location is a little awkward so a hotel nearer the Trevi Fountain may be better.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: DrMarkOReilly
Reviews.Content: Shocking poor! The website and general reviews online are somewhat misleading, and would lead you to think that this is a quality hotel. Albeit the staff were friendly, the hotel never lead up to the hype. The location was decent, in the business section of the City, North Rome. Near Villa Borghese Gardens. The rooms were the biggest let down. Really poor! 30 degrees in Rome when we went and there was no refrigerator in the room, the "jacuzzi was basically a bath with two jet pumps. We didn't use it through out huge disappointment. The room itself was not nicely decorated. The ceiling had cracks in it and a lot of scrape marks along the white wall, the room basically needs a remake. We forked out 300EUR for 2 nights. There was no balcony. There was 5-6 channels on the tele when we got in at late night, not the 20+ international channels it stated. Lastly, 15E per per person for the continental breakfast. SO TO SUMMARISE; Choose a hotel more central, near the Trevi Fountain for a hotel which more than likely would be better!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: yesmiss
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel a day after Rome had suffered from terrible storms to find that our room was not available, the hotel had 12 rooms out of action. They arranged for us to be taken to an alternative hotel for the night and paid for our taxi fair too. A day later, tired after sight seeing, we checked into the Romanico Palace. Our room was on the fourth floor over-looking the street below. We had a Juliet balcony, dressing gowns and slippers. The room was beautifully decorated, very Roman in style. We found the staff to be friendly and very helpful. Breakfast on the roof top terrace was a delight with pastries, cold meats and cheeses on offer and hot choices if you wanted them. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “4 STARS WORTH 3 NOT VERY SHINING STARS”
Reviews.Author: GProenca
Reviews.Content: Fairly good location near via Venneto. Small rooms and bathrooms. Poor isolation both acoustic and thermic. Airconditioning not working. Only 1 elevator working resulting in long waiting times. Buffet breakfast with very limited choices. If possible, avoid.

Reviews.Title: “4 night stay in the Hotel Romanico Palace, Rome”
Reviews.Author: Julie B
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 5 day stay here at the end of September 2011. Took my husband to Rome for his "21st" birthday and we had a great time. Hotel was lovely, staff REALLY helpful and the room was delightful. Hotel is just opposite the American Embassey and even tho' we had a main street side room, it was SO quiet. The room was very nicely decorated, VERY clean, bed was REALLY comfy, free safe, enough storage & haning space, good heating/airconditioning and lovely clean bathroom. Breakfast was super on the roof garden with good views. The only minus points were: 1) although there was a mini bar, there was no tea or coffee in the room 2) the only English speaking channels on the flat screen tv were CNN, BBC World News & MTV - so if you want to relax after a day walking in Rome take a good book or your ipod & speakers!!!! 3) you had to pay 5 euros for fresh orange juice at breakfast. Overall though, it was a lovley experience for our 1st trip to Rome & I'd give it a 4.2 on the score board and we would definately use it again. :) :)

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Garish, But Very Well Located”
Reviews.Author: Troon62
Reviews.Content: Our second-floor room overlooking busy Via Boncompagni was large by European standards and well appointed (except for the silly hot tub/shower/bath with two floor-to-ceiling windows onto the bedroom. Taking a shower was virtually impossible). The faux marble statue, about five feet high, on one wall was a bit much, as well. There were no remotes for the two tv monitors in our room. When I called for assistance, a surly doorman came, couldn't find one, and left. An hour later, trying to be polite, we called again. Guess who materialized, more surly than before, with a remote, which worked for only one monitor. On the whole, these were minor negatives, given the quality of the accommodations and their space. While the Via Veneto is only two blocks away, that avenue's halcyon days are long since gone. What you find today are ridiculously over-priced eateries and nightclubs eager to over-charge unaware, well-off tourists. Another negative is that the immediate area surrounding the hotel is given over almost totally to financial and corporate institutions. It is as remote as one can get from the daily reality of life in greater Rome. If we were to do it all over again, we would find an equally comfortable hotel in a much more "Roman" neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, watch out for the elevator”
Reviews.Author: Orioles1947
Reviews.Content: First time to Rome and part of a tour with Insight Tours. Older hotel with red and gold ancient rome (opulent) decor. Room on the fourth floor was comfortable and clean with a handheld shower in the bathroom. Located five minutes from Via Veneto, 15 minute walk to Spanish Steps. Terrific continental breakfast with a wonderful view of Rome from the seventh floor terrace. Was very hot in Rome - 33 Celsius/92 Fahrenheit and the air conditioning was not fully functional resulting in a warm room. The hotel also charged 5 Euros/hour for wi-fy. We also got stuck in the elevator between the first and second floors with another couple. We tried ringing the emergency alarm in the elevator and finally two bellhops responded and little by little cranked and jerked the elevator down to where we able to jump out the remaining four feet to the ground floor after pushing open the doors - just making the bus for the drive to the Colosseum. They provided water for us once an opening appeared in the shaft under the second floor through the open doors - the elevator became very warm. This must have happened on previous occasions since the staff had tools to handle the situation. Total time involved was probably around 15 minutes but it seemed considerably longer. When we returned to the hotel later in the afternoon the elevator was fixed but my wife would not go in it. Eventually everything worked out.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK!”
Reviews.Author: jgentner
Reviews.Content: Just left Rome and wanted to say that my wife and I do not agree with many of these reviews of the Romanico. A Palace, it is NOT! The decor was a bit overdone. The room was a sufficient size and it had a jet-tub, but it only had a handheld shower, which was awkward to use while INSIDE the tub. Also, we noticed immediately that the air-conditioning was not working properly. When we asked about it, they said it was fixed, but with the mid 80s temperatures while we were there, the room never got cool. And, in the middle of the night, we noticed that the air was automatically going off, leaving us tossing and turning all night! The hairdryer in the bathroom did not work. We reported it but it was never fixed. On the plus side, the rooftop breakfast was very nice. We liked the location as walking around to sights was easy. It was also very near the Roma Termini, which was nice. We are going back to Rome in 3 weeks, as we end our trip to Italy but we are glad that we picked a different hotel for that stay .

Reviews.Title: “very good not first class”
Reviews.Author: LondonWiggies
Reviews.Content: excellent location 15 minutes walk from spanish steps. a really nice hotel with very friendly staff and it would be unlikely to disappoint anyone. the breakfast on the top floor in a very sunny enclosed roof terrace was a great setting. would recommend without reservation. the only reason not given an excellent rating is because the breakfast was not first class with hot choice, or fresh juice and because the air conditioning was not quite powerful enough to cope with hot rome summers. nevertheless, we still had a great stay. recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The **only** place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Todd M
Reviews.Content: As I stayed at the Romanico Palace for 6 weeks, I feel quite entitled to leave this glowing review. My favorite things: the staff, my friends in the breakfast room on the top floor took great care of me each and every morning, greeting me with smiles and serving up delicious cappuccino. They were never too busy to answer any questions I had about Rome and were genuinely interested in making sure that I enjoyed my time in Italy. The view was amazing as well. What better way to start one's day than with an outstanding breakfast while enjoying all of Rome displayed right before your eyes! The entire staff of the hotel was a delight, always making me feel welcome and assisting me with whatever I needed. The room was clean and comfortable for the time I spent there. This was not much as the Romanico Palace is in a perfect location, not within the quite crowded tourists areas but just nearby. This hotel is not far from the Termini train station, giving you easy access to anywhere in Italy, and is also within walking distance to the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, Villa Borghese, Piazza del Popolo, the Pantheon, etc. The Romanico Palace was my home for 6 wonderful weeks and I regret that my stay had to end.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: mlejcogs
Reviews.Content: Hmm, what to say about this place? It was fine, but not as posh as it's trying to be, is the best way to describe it. It's a lovely location in a lovely neighbourhood not far from the Via Veneto; and just a couple of blocks away from the American Embassy compound, so handy it that's your destination. Also walking distance from Santa Maria della Vittoria, home to Bernini's statue of St. Theresa, which was definitely worth seeing. There is a taxi stand a block up the street, and a lovely fruit and veg stand selling amazing fresh produce on the opposit corner. The hotel is pleasant and clean, but the rooms are small, in spite of the grandiose nouveau-Ancient Rome decor. The lobby lounge/bar is very pleasant, and the place where the air conditioning works best in the building. The barman is charming and service is pleasant; he is quick to refill the bowls of nuts and snacks while taking your drinks order. The booze, however, is Expensive! Our room was on the front of the building, and the traffic on the street can be noisy in the evening. The rooftop breakfast room is a nice spot with great views over the city. The breakfast is adequate, but Continental only, not full breakfast, and the service was a bit hurry-up-so-we-can-get-out-of-here. Also, this is the one place in Italy where we encountered bad coffee. I was shocked, but because coffee in Italy seemed uniformly excellent. However, avoid the coffee urn on the breakfast bar, it's awful, and instead order a cappucino or macchiato - they will do one up for you fresh, and there was no extra charge. Drawbacks: no free internet, 5 Euros buys you an hour; no newspapers; no coffee/tea making facility in the room. Also, which I found a bit offensive, a sign in the room informing you that bringing your own food or drink into the room is forbidden! I'm in Italy and I can't bring a bottle of wine into my room to enjoy a quiet drink with my husband, or some snacks for my son? Needless to say, we ignored the sign. This rule struck me as particularly niggling, trying to force you to use the lobby lounge; and when combined with the lack of internet, began to make one feel a bit nickle-and-dimed. There is no restaurant on the premises, just the breakfast room for breakfast only. Would I stay there again? Not the worst hotel by any means, but probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Marti42643
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at Romanico Palace. Suggested great resturants at a reasonable price and the desk staff went above and beyond to make our stay pleasant. Rooftop breakfast was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Joaniebond
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the hotel from 1st-5th of Sept 2011. The staff are very friendly and it was my daughters 18th birthday so It was arranged to have some balloons in the room., they sorted this all out for when we arrived, our room was ready when we checked in early. They were all very helpful on the desk and at the bar. The hotel is in a nice area, a 10 minute walk to the Villa Bourghese and Zoo and very near the Via Veneto which has several restaurants and bars, including the Hard rock Cafe. CLose to the Tour bus stop if you want to use this and just a short walk to the Taxi rank. Rome is beautiful and we enjoyed our stay here, although in general Rome is expensive, this hotel is good value for money. I would recommend using this hotel. JB London

Reviews.Title: “A true European 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoeurVoyager
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 7 nights on our first trip to Rome. We arrived at the hotel before 9 a.m. due to an early flight. The hotel took care of our luggage and told us we could check in a few hours early if our room was ready. We came back around 1 p.m., and we were promptly given our room keys. Our bags followed a few minutes later. Needless to say, the staff is friendly, attentive, and they speak English very well. We stayed in a standard double room: Room 222. The room was a little small, but for Europe, that's to be expected. We had no drawers or dressers, just two small closets built into the bed for us to hang up our clothes. We kept most of our stuff packed in the luggage. The bathroom was nice - no tub however. But it was clean and classy, so we were happy with it. The bed is rather firm and the pillows are as flat as pancakes. When I chatted with friends who were staying at a Marriott near the airport, they experienced the same thing with their bedding. Must be the Italian way. We got used to it even though we would have preferred a softer bed. My only real gripe with the hotel is that they didn't inform us that there would be a city tax to be paid upon check out. It would have been helpful for them to mention that to us, especially because they require it in CASH. We had to turn over our last euros that were for our taxi to the airport and then have them call a more expensive cab that could take credit card. Not the best way to end what was otherwise a pleasant stay. The hotel is nearby the American Embassy, a close walking distance to the Spanish Steps and the Villa Borghese. We walked mostly everywhere - even down to the Pantheon and Roman Forum. The nearest metro stop is Barberini, which is about a 15 minute walk away. If your breakfast is not included in your room, I suggest hopping down to Pepy's, which is an open air cafe right on the Barberini Piazza next to the metro. A good breakfast for half the price of Romanico's. I highly recommend this hotel. If you're OK with walking, you'll enjoy this beautiful hotel in a quieter section of Rome. If we ever come back to this city (let's hope those coins we threw in the Trevi fountain work), I would definitely consider staying here. It was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo0608
Reviews.Content: Myself And my wife stayed at the hotel on our first visit to Rome. We both thought that the hotel was excellent. When we arrived we were met by English speaking staff who were very helpful. The hotels location is excellent you are 15 to 25 minutes walk to all the sights with the exception of the vatican. This can be reached from the underground which is also a short walk. To have breakfast on the room is amazing and again the staff can't help you enough. If we ever go back to Rome we would both stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “cute bedroom , but shower need clean the mold”
Reviews.Author: brazil_cat_30
Reviews.Content: After travel around italy we return to rome again. we find hotel romanico .good location and decor. we stay for 2 nites. every think is pay in extra like Wi Fi 10 euros for 3 hours, breakfast 20 euro for person and very simple continental breakfast we rit the road and find a cafe for a breakfast .I am pickyee about food not simple breakfast can make me Happy.I think i can stay again . also wifi not work in 4 floor i need go to main room to use my laptop

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Jason B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because it was nearby another hotel i had reserved that ended up not being open and ready for my arrival. the staff here are wonderfull and i had a great time here. it is centrally located in Rome which make most of the attractions within an easy walking distance. the only issue i had was with my keycard not working to let me in to the enterance way to my hotel room but it makes for a good story to tell.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful suprise - Great room, bathroom, staff and awesome breakfast”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTexascouple
Reviews.Content: Had stayed 2 blocks down on Via Veneto at the Westin Excelsior in prior years and at 430 euros per night for 2 nights before flying home thought we'd try something a little less expensive. I was shocked when I arrived, as my wife booked the hotel off tripadvisor 2 hours before catching a flight to Rome from Mykonos for 103 euros a night, to find a spectacular room with a bathroom nicer than the Westin. The faux painting and furnishings in the room are, well, romantic.The bed was heavenly type, with high thread count cotton sheets , and the bathroom had a jacuzzi tub, multi spray shower, olive oil soap, full plush terry cloth monogramed towels, and bidet. The staff that welcomed us at reception, a young man and woman in their 20's both blonde and blued(I do not remember their names), checked us in in minutes and our bags were brought to the room before we got to it by the bellman. After a good rest we asked where they reccomended for dinner and the desk staff both enthusiastically told us to go to a restaurant 3 blocks away and made reservations without being asked. The restaurant was terrific. The curtains had blackout curtains behind them and there was no noise in the room from the outside for peaceful sleeping. When I went down around 10 the next morning to look for breakfast ed(which we were told when checking in was included) I thought it would be off the lobby, but was told to go to the top floor. Wow, a surround glass restaurant on the top floor just for breakfast with a great view. . When I saw the pastries and danish variety along with anything else you could want, and a full staff impeccably dressed running and replenishing the fresh juices and all the food and pastries( as it rapidly disappeared) I went back to my room and told my wife,who had told me the night before she would just sleep and skip breakfast,that she had to see this to believe it. She came and was also suprised at the view over Rome from the top of the hotel and the great food. The lobby had a full selection of newspapers in all languages for guests. Wireless internet for five euros an hour was available. On Sunday when we left for the airport I asked for a taxi, which are fixed price 40 euros, which we knew and is also posted all over the hotel area on the Via Veneto, and the hotel concierge asked if we would like a mercedes sedan to take us for 50 euros. Having endurred the taxi ride from the airport we jumped at the opportunity and left in the same luxury as our stay at the hotel. We expect to come back for 2 weeks Christmas of this year, Rome, Venice, Florence., and I will stay here again. The value is incredible and the hotel enthusiastically reccomended

Reviews.Title: “nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: ugo1974
Reviews.Content: For one who is used to the average standard of the four-star hotels in the center of Rome, it was a nice surprise. I chose it simply because of its location, close to Via Vittorio Veneto and just 15 minutes walking from Termini railway station, just getting into the first "good looking one" after a tiring day. The service was ok, the room was clean and in good conditions, room endowment was satisfactory (better than most of the average Rome's four-star hotel), breakfast good, nice personnel, good view from the terrace restaurant at 7th floor. There's also a spa, though I had no time to experience it. No negative notes.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect from a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewDvisor
Reviews.Content: We looked for a cheap 4 star in a great location- and that's what we got. The room wasn't big but it was more than enough. The staff at the reception were always willing to help with directions, restaurants etc. The breakfast was what we expected- a basic continential breakfast, the big bonus is the view from the seventh floor of the hotel. The only problem i remember is that once (out of 4 times we ate there), the hot water and the coffee weren't very hot- however, i did see the hotel staff fixing the problem after a few minutes. I presonally got the breakfast as a part of a deal, so i don't know the exact price, but one of the other guests told me that it's 25 euros. As I've already written, the room wasn't very big. It had a few other problems: the shower wasn't working too well (the tub didn't drain quickly enough) and the toilet was making a lot of noise when the water refilled. The TV was a small blurry LCD screen, but it did have a few international channels. The hotel lies on a busy street, so there is some noise 24 hours a day (especially because of how common scooters are in rome). The hotel is served by 2 elevators, so there weren't any problems in this regard. Perheps the construction which is mentioned in one of the reviews is one of the elevators, which is the bigger one and seems extremely new. The big advantage of this hotel is its location: around 10-15 minutes from one of rome's metro stations- which makes accessing most of the city extremely easy. Also it's in a walking distance from trevi's fountain, the spanish stairs and the Pantheon. In addition it's just a few minutes from a bus station and there are dozens of restaurants nearby. The hotel offers airport transportation for 80 euros, but it's possible to walk 2 minutes to the nearby taxi station and get there for 40. There is Wi-Fi, but it costs 20 euros per day. In conclusion, this is a good 4 star hotel, great if you want to explore rome more than you want to stay in the hotel. Not perfect, but great value for its cheap price. I'll recommend it for anyone who looks for a cheap hotel in a central location in Rome. *I have to add a short review about the cafe just next to the hotel, which does not appear on tripadvisor. Stay away from it- for the price of average coffee, a piece of cake and average service you can get a full meal in one of the nearby Italian restaurants. I also have to say that the hotel staff did not say anything about it, we just ate there once because it was so close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK price”
Reviews.Author: Niqueh12
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was great, just a few blocks from the Spanish steps and from there we were able to see Trevi fountain and the Coliseum by just following the signs. We got nicer rooms than expected even though we declined the offered upgrade at an additional price. Parking was pricey at 35 Euro per night and breakfast was 15 Euro a person. Skip their breakfast and head down the streets for a wonderful (and cheap) cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Was not as good as it looked from the outside”
Reviews.Author: morau
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 6 nights. We originally booked a standard room but did an upgrade to a suite when we arrived at the hotel (+ 300 Euro). The room was nice on the first impression. at a second glance there were a lot of hair on the bed and in the bath room. It had a jacuzzi, but there were some mosaic stones missing so dirt was coming into the water when you wanted to fill it. Next day we complained and they said that they will fix it until the evening, but they didn`t do anything, even though they said the "problem" was fixed. We complained again and we then were sent to another room, smaller, no balcony and jacussi inside the room (for the same price!). In this room the air condition was not working, the water of the jacuzzi ran into the room from underneath and the little table next to the bad fall almost of its fixation when I wanted put something on it. We then agreed to go back to the old room, which was bigger, had the balcony and at least the air conition was working. They said, they will which the mosaic stones in the jacuzzi but they never did. Also they could not really help with questions for events and sight seeing tours in Rome. My conclusion: This is not supposed to be a 4 star hotel and they charge to much money for these conditions! Would not recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Constant negotiation-not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: AllieinAZ
Reviews.Content: One expects to negotiate with taxi drivers etc, but not with the front desk of a "4 Star" hotel. Two concrete examples.........We were told that 20 euros for breakfast was for a "hot American breakfast"-I specifically asked. When we arrived for breakfast, we were told that the price was 25 euros and it was "only continential". I went down to the front desk and after much discussion, a phone call was made and we were able to get eggs and bacon for 20 euros (however, one day it took them 25 minutes to bring our eggs and one day the eggs and bacon were basically raw-not cooked at all) When trying to set up the transfer to the airport, we were quoted 3 different prices. It became a joke between us. When we saw someone new at the front desk we would ask just to hear the price. The range 50-60 euros. Many of the reviews are very true- clean room, small, friendly bartender, unhappy staff..... I would not recommend this hotel and would never stay here again. Staff barely smiled except the bartender, who was most friendly and always smiled.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again..........Standard Room was terrible”
Reviews.Author: BWK2011
Reviews.Content: We booked our room on Travelocity, when we checked in they charged us an additional fee of Euro 2 per person per night (which is against Travelocity rules), but no big deal as it was not that much. They then took us to our room, which was an upgrade to a Jr. Suite, but it was in the building next door, which is an apt. building where they have 2 floors. A very old elevator makes accessing this annex slow and difficult, due to some construction going on. When we asked for a room in the hotel, they said we had booked a standard room and showed us their standard room (on the first floor). It was absolutely terrible, dingy, old, dark, it was at best a one star hotel room. We were told we could either have this room or the one in the Annex. What they offered us was one of the worst hotel rooms I've ever seen in a hotel that purports to be 3 star. Ever. The staff were generally helpful and nice, with the exception of an older gentlemen who worked during the day who was rude and arrogant. I wouldn't stay here again if the rooms were free.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: tswgaf
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed here for 4 nights, and really enjoyed our stay. The staff are so friendly and helpful. The rooms are really nice and clean, albeit with quite a lot of gold décor, but it is Rome after all :-) Breakfast was standard continental, but served in the rooftop restaurant with great views of city, and excellent coffees! The road on 2 sides of the hotel are quite busy, but not too much noise in the rooms, if you are a light sleeper maybe ask for a room at the back of the hotel. There were some negative reviews about this hotel, please ignore! Rome is amazing, and should be seen by everyone...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LaurenBlauvelt
Reviews.Content: My son, daughter and I shared a triple and we stayed here as part of a tour. It is only blocks away from Borghese Gardens, and we were able to walk to many major sights including the Spanish Steps. The room was comfortable, and the included buffet breakfast was pretty good - and on the 7th floor with a great view of Rome! We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Sounds better than it is”
Reviews.Author: gushouhe
Reviews.Content: I won't exaggerate; Romanico is not terrible. But it's not great either, at least not what you expect from a 4-star hotel. Excellent location, we walked to the Spanish steps everyday. Terribly rude manager Ridiculous breakfast. Do yourselves a favour - save money and eat breakfast out, not at the hotel. I've had better breakfasts at youth hostels! The rooms are clean and nicely decorated. But don't be fooled by the pictures. The suites are cool, yes, but if you get a standard double room you're in for a surprise. A boring room in the basement with no windows! They will offer you the possibility to upgrade to a room with a window for a large sum of money, and my guess is that most people choose to upgrade. Who wants to stay in a 4 star hotel without windows? If you do pay the extra money for a better room, with windows and a view, the view is great. But in retrospect, when I realised all the extra money we paid (for the upgrade, for the pathetic breakfast etc), I realised we could have booked a 5 star hotel in the city centre for the same amount. All in all: great location but you pay more than what it's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable, affordable hotel"”
Reviews.Author: travels4jen
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Romanico Palace Hotel during our trip to Rome in March 2011. The hotel was nice overall, small rooms but always very clean. Who goes to Rome to sit in a hotel room anyway! The location was great! We walked to everything, everywhere, and it was nice to be right around the corner from Villa Borghese...a nice reprieve from the crowded streets in the center of Rome. The price was great and we were able to check in early without paying the usual 25 euro early check-in fee. The only issue we encountered was we booked thru Travelocity and the hotel wanted to add a tourist tax to our bill when we checked in, which we were never informed of through Travelocity. The desk clerk was very understanding and resolved our issue with Travelocity directly. Overall, a very pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice & great location”
Reviews.Author: bboop907
Reviews.Content: Staff was helpful. When we had a shower leak they immediately repaired it. Bar is nice. Can walk to lots of sites.

Reviews.Title: “In 2009, it was great, in 2011, it had gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: Costumaker
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a 4 star hotel, even if the ratings say so. My husband and I stayed at this hotel on our last trip to Rome in 2009, and were pleasantly anticipating a repetition of the experience. This time, our 2 adult children (daughter 28, son 26) were with us. I communicated directly with the hotel several months ago to get an appropriate family room. We arrived late morning to store our bags until we could check in. When we got into the room,it had 2 large beds, rather than the one large and 2 twin beds that had been promised. When I went to the desk to complain, they told us that there was an appropriate room (that had been promised), but it wasn't available until the next day. Neither room had any drawer space to hold clothes, which was rather awkward for a week long stay. Neither room had adequate hanging space for more than 2 people. One of the reasons we had enjoyed our first stay was the roof-top terrace breakfast. This time, there was less variation; there was fruit choices, including fresh fruit salad, the first time. This time, there were some limited number of whole fruit. The cold cut and cheese selections had some variations last time. This time, it was standard, with the only cheese every day being Swiss. The breakfast staff was entirely friendly and approachable. The front desk was polite, but not particularly welcoming. The internet was acceptable, but not entirely reliable. With 4 adults, it would have been nice to have had at least 2 keys to the room so that we could come back independently on some days. (Children in their 20s sometimes cover more ground than their parents near 60.) For some reason which I never understood, they said they could not provide us with 2 keys, which were electronic and not physical. This caused some scheduling problems. I asked for 3 extra pillows the first night, which were removed and had to be requested again. I asked for 2 extra towels a day, which were provided once. (I didn't feel like bugging them every day.) I would not stay here again. I would call this a 3 star hotel with 1 star service and 4 star prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and the best barman in Italy”
Reviews.Author: RobbiePerthAustralia
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for four nights and loved the Romanico Palace. It's a great location for those looking to stay in a classier part of Rome. As 2 ladies in our 60s, we found it quite comfortable to walk in the evening to any of the huge choice of great little restaurants in the blocks around the hotel. We also had no trouble walking from most of the tourist sites. However, if you just walk staight along from the hotel across the Via Veneto for a couple of blocks, there is a stop where you can pick up any of the hop on hop off bus services. The rooms are spotlessly clean, with lovely linens and the shower is superb. Breakfast in the rooftop restaurant is delightful. They have a continental buffet, or you can order an omelette if you prefer. the staff are helpful and extremely professional. But the icing on the cake is coming back of an evening, and being looked after in the bar on the ground floor by the amazing Valerio. We so enjoyed the loevly relaxed atmosphere he creates, and chatted with many guest for around the world who were also enjoying the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel. Horrible location.”
Reviews.Author: natcounts
Reviews.Content: Horrible Location. Not as close as advertised. The staff stuck us in the adjoining hotel Veneto. Not what I paid for. Wifi was E20 for 24hrs. Thats ridiculous especially since this was the most expensive hotel we stayed at in Italy and the others were free to E2 per day. I was looking forward to this hotel the most on our trip, and was extremely disappointed. Dont use the "private car service". They charge E60 to get to FCO> a cab down the street was E40. Breakfast was mediocre. The shower was the only positive.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel, great friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TLC61
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed In Hotel Romanico for a week in April. Their driver picked us up at the airport, the concierges immediately carried our luggage to the room which was immaculate, well decorated and had a small balcony, fridge, safe and hairdryer, the staff bent over backwards to be helpful and it was only a 10 minute walk from the Spanish Steps and 5 mins from Villa Borghese which was a lovely park to spend the day in. They had a really pleasant and helpful member of staff (Valentina) dedicated to helping guests plan and book their sightseeing. The barman, Valerio, kept us entertained nightly with his banter and in general all the staff were extremely helpful and friendly and spoke good english. The only downside to our stay in Rome was we dont like continental breakfasts but we could hardly blame the hotel for that. Also do not order a taxi in Rome because they are wildly expensive, get a bus, its so much cheaper and they cover all areas. We would have no hesitation in recommending Hotel Romanico to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for location”
Reviews.Author: dyad6336
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be nice for a few nights stay. We were in a good location in the city- about 15 min walk to trevi, and around the corner from the Spanish steps. We like to walk and we were able to walk to the colessium in under 20 minutes or so and all of the sites with the exception of having to hop on a bus to the vatican. The breakfast on the roof is nice it its included. Unfortunately ours did not have it included and there was a misunderstanding on our part at the desk. If its not included its 15 euro pp. I told the desk that I was upset by the fact that we really only had toast and were wrongly under the impression that it was included and the front desk gentleman was very nice about the situation and did not charge our room. He also let us into the gym which is very very small you would fair better to do some extra city walking instead. Overall I would stay here again. The room was nice, clean, and my fiance loved the shower!

Reviews.Title: “Great little jewel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Andrea60811
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in April. Great location, walking distance to Spanish Steps, Via Veneto and shopping but in a quiet area. Rooftop breakfast has standard European fare and a fabulous view, a great way to start the day. Rooms are small compared to US but typical for Europe. Clean and well kept. Valentina Riccardi at Guest Relations was great in helping us arrange tours and local information. We traveled with 3 teens and could walk every evening for a gelato or shopping. This is a good hotel for families who are looking for a comfortable hotel with easy access to public transportation and local flavor.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good hotel, good staff, average location”
Reviews.Author: loveTheMap
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived, they gave told us we have been upgraded to a suite. We came in around midnight, and were happy to hear that. The staff was very friendly and professional. I must say that the reviews on trip advisor made me a little nervous, so I was expecting the worse, it was not bad at all. The break fast itself was ordinary, (croissants, some cakes, cereal and fruits). Capaccino was excellent, they even made some designs on it. Coffee on roof top was fun. Staff was friendly and at times also entertained and engaged with my 5year old son. The room was huge, biggest one we got in italy, had a jacuzzi. Rooms were kept clean. Since many folks had warned us against theft in general in italy, we did not leave any important belongings, such as money, passports etc, however from the looks of it, hotel staff was good and trust worthy. The location was average. The closest metro stations were barberini, reppublicca and termini. Termini is about a 20 minute walk and barberini and republica are about 15 minutes. The bus stations are pretty close, we simply took 63, 52 and 910 to the station. Took a little while to get used to the bus routes, but figured it out eventually. The hotel does give the impression that there is a charge for everything, which may make a budget traveler slightly nervous. The hotel in this era should provide free internet, and if nothing atleast a common PC for customers to access. (I had a bed and breakfast which I paid half the cost provide such a service, so would be hard to think a 7 story hotel would not do that). The only other negative feedback I had was, the hotel can get a little noisy. Rome being the last leg on my trip, I was very accustomed to noise so not a biggy. The hotel is at an intersection, so buses and cars can get noisy. Also, air only works in summer and is off in off season like late march to mid april. One more thing, there is a city tax you have to pay in cash at the end of your stay. The hotel will not tell you that when you check in (They should). But since I had read about it, I was prepared. I think its 5 euros a night, so if you have an early check out, make sure you have that cash so you don't have to worry about finding ATM when you have a train to catch in the next hour. Overall, a pretty good hotel, good staff, average location, and potential to be awesome with minor tweaks. Don't be nervous, they are all right.

Reviews.Title: “Don't take too much notice of the negative reviews.”
Reviews.Author: johnandsue27
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome to celebrate our second wedding anniversary and my wife selected the hotel online and booked it direct. The booking process was trouble free and all emails were helpful and friendly. Our room was plenty big enough, bath and shower were great. The room cleanliness was excellent - well done to the housekeepers! The bed was firm and comfortable and we both slept well. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, reception staff and concierge went out of the way to help. The barman was amazing and was keen to practice his English to tell us about his love of football. Breakfast in the rooftop restaurant was good, again all staff were helpful. It was a Continental Breakfast, but the website and booking process clearly stated that - after all, we were in Rome so we didn't expect Full English! The hotel is in a great location, we enjoy walking so it was easy for us to get to the city centre each day. Just 5 minutes walk away is Via Vittorio Veneto which is full of restaurants and bars so we were spoilt for choice as to where to eat each night and we weren't disappointed - the food was great. We booked our flights and airport transfer direct with Ryanair and the only slight hiccup was the late arrival of our transfer back to Ciampino Airport, but the reception staff were even happy to sort that out for us - a big thank you! Overall, an amazing experience. Rome is a wonderful city and the Romanico Palace Hotel is a great base to see it from.

Reviews.Title: “Romanico Palace is nice...but not great.”
Reviews.Author: bjskid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Romanico Palace for a week in February 2011. We initially had booked a standard room attempting to save money for other Rome activities but these rooms were really small. Being American I understand the difference between what we are used to in the States and what is offered in Europe and this is not a fault of the hotel's. We upgraded to a "suite" and were comfortable but understand that a suite at Romanico is equivalent to a standard room in the states. The decor is tasteful but looks to have been done somewhat on the cheap. Molding and door frames didn't quite mate with the walls and the feel was of a more modestly priced establishment. The room and hotel itself was very clean and neat. The staff were extremely helpful and professional. The bar wasn't staffed during it's advertised hours but a drink or coffee could be obtained by speaking with the front desk. This was moderatly inconveniant. The bartenders, when on duty, were great and made some great cocktails. The free breakfast was small (no hot food) but very appetizing and a great way to start a long day of sightseeing. The breakfast area was located on top of the hotel and offered some splendid views. The location isn't horrible but not as conveneniant as some of the pricier hotels on Via Veneto. If you're able to travel on foot the location isn't a big game changer but at night if you want to step out for a late drink or bite to eat it's about a 4 block stroll to Via Veneto, although there are some resteraunts and cafe's in the local area. Also, internet access isn't free and must be purchased by the hour. The logout procedure is not always successful which causes minutes to be used up. Something to keep in mind...those euros add up after a while. All in all I can't say that I was disappointed in the Hotel Romanico just not overly thrilled. It was neat, clean and professionally run and that counts for a lot. After all I was there to see Rome not the hotel. If you're on somewhat of a budget then this is a great place to set up base camp. If you can afford 3 or 4 times the rate then I would suggest you go to one of the better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “SImply Poor”
Reviews.Author: NathanBlau
Reviews.Content: Both me and my friends, in rooms close by, had to move due to bad smell from drains. No apologies but moved with little grace and no assistance. This was followed by tow nights of problems with loud America students in next room partying - no assistance offered by staff to deal with this depsite many people complaining. Had to pay 20 euros per person (check the small print) per day for breakfast or spa. Chose breakfast on;y to find that for this money you get only bread/ham/cheese - eggs and bacon are 7:50 extra in addition to your original 20 Euros i.e. a 27.50 breakfast. On two out of three mornings eggs were sent back as had been clearly cooked long before and reheated in microwave. Food simply taken away with shrug of shoulders and no apology. Comments to manager seemed to elicit little sypathy or apology ........ AVOID .... THIS IS NOT A $ STAR HOTEL - DESPITE ORNATE ROOMS ON UPGRADE THIS IS LITTLE BETTER THAN A TRAVELLERS HOSTEL

Reviews.Title: “Clean room with reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: roycinus
Reviews.Content: Pro: 1. Good price. I paid $120+tax 2. Free breakfast. (just basic bread+coffee/juice) 3. Quiet and safe location 4. Room is clean and the size is acceptable. Con: 1. 15 minutes uphill walk from Metro. Take 52 53 63 bus instead. 2. Internet is slow. It costs 5 euro /hr or 10 euro/3hr 3. Strict check in check out policy. Early check in 25 euro, late check out 45 euro. They do have free luggage storage. 4. Bed is not the best, but acceptable. 5. Small TV and mounted on the wall. Conclusion: Not a 4 Star, but this is much better than the Veneto Hotel next door which owned by the same company. Much better experience than the same price/star at Veneto. This is a priceline hotel, so check the price before bidding.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience ever!!!! AVOID AVOID AVOID”
Reviews.Author: Nandj2011
Reviews.Content: Ok, To keep this as brief as possible, my partner and I booked the Hotel Romanico for our anniversary and were looking forward to 4days in Rome. Upon booking the hotel we thought we had secured a great stay, our package included airport transfers, breakfasts and coliseum tickets (the coliseum tickets were a big draw card as we wanted to avoid queues and with pre tickets it would have been perfect) From our arrival to departure things got worse every day, our airport transfer didn’t arrive, after two calls to our hotel they finally said someone would be sent. We waited over an hour in the airport, upon arrival to the hotel no apology was offered and we were told the Coliseum tickets were not able to be booked. (I had given the hotel enough email notifications about our stay to insure the tickets were booked) I could go on forever with things they did not do- but in short, stay somewhere else if you’re looking for a relaxing weekend without any problems. Avoid this hotel at all costs, my wife and I have stayed at a number of hotels across Europe and never have we experience problems like this. The main reason for posting this review is to prevent others from experiencing these problems; it just ruins your holiday! In the end we had to buy our own Coliseum passes and wasted over half the day queuing to get tickets, we then had to claim back the money from the hotel. Total hassle and ruined a day of site seeing. Staff: Unhelpful and rude, no manager to assist during our stay, bar tender was the nicest guy and should find another place to work, the hotel is bringing him down! Room: Our bed was hard; air conditioning unit did not work and was never fixed during our stay. (We advised the front desk every morning but nothing was every done about the air conditioning) Location: Close to the Spanish steps and train station but so are loads of other hotels, nothing great about this place and next time we’ll be avoiding this hotel. Breakfast: Just basic stuff, nothing to write home about. All in all, the worst hotel experience and we have stayed in plenty over the last 10years. We live in London and travel Europe regularly and this was so bad it's prompted me to write this review. (You may be interested to know, I've sent a letter of complaint to the hotel and also emailed twice, it's been 2weeks and still no response. I’ve called to speak to the manager Alessandro and left messages for him to contact me but still nothing. Shows what they think of their customers) You have been warned; if I was you avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better, badly managed hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Disco13
Reviews.Content: Booked on-line through lastminute.com and thought we got a great bargain. The small print told us we had to pay an extra €40.00 per day, which we eventually decided was still a good price. When we got there we had to pick between a breakfast or time in their "spa" (a steam room and a sauna...that's it) for our €40.00 per day. Breakfast was far from worth €20.00 each, it was your bog standard continental breakfast, very disappointing!! Our room was beside the lift lobby and didn't sleep a wink on the first night, so we moved room. After a second night and an over priced breakfast we decided we would upgrade to a suit for our €40.00 per day and it was much better.
