On checking out the manager told us we had to pay €3.00 per person per day "city tax" which was only payable in cash, because this was not advertised anywhere or we were not informed before our trip this left a bad taste after an otherwise enjoyable time spent in Rome. Other issues i would have: Staff seemed poorly trained The bar man made the worst cocktails you could imagine You would normally expect slippers and a dressing gown in a 4 star hotel but not this wanna be 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “do not listen to negativ reviews!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amrie_89
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. I bought a trip to Rome for my partners christmas pressie. We are both well travelled people and my father was an airline pilot so needless to say i have stayed in many hotels before. I booked directly with the hotel which i advise you to do. I had a package deal consisting of picking up from the airport to the hotel, drinks on arrival, a lovely room and tickets to the colleseum, paletine hill and roman forum. The room is slightly on the small side but was plenty big enough for the two of us. It had lovely high ceilings which made the room feel bigger. In the room there were all your basics and had thick towelling robes, plenty of towels, toothbrushes, shower gel etc. There was a jacuzzi bath and rainfall shower. Yes you could hear traffic outside but what do you expect your in a city! The hotel was very central for visiting everything. It is about a half hour walk to the colleseum or the vatican with lots of sites on the way. The trevi fountain and spanish steps are the nearest. There are great restaurants at the end of the street like Harrys Bar, Venetian and Cafe de Paris. I would reccomend this place to anyone wanting to experience Rome and be central to everything. Dont get put off by other reviews that have been given. I was panicking with these reviews thinking what have i done, but we would certainly go back to this hotel. xx

Reviews.Title: “A missed opportunity in so many ways.”
Reviews.Author: PaulF1966
Reviews.Content: This was rated as 4 star but is far from it. Greeted with an initial frosty reception from the concierge who has clearly become jaded with the hospitality industry he became temporarily nicer when I asked to change rooms. My first non smoking room smelled of smoke and there was a glass half filled with beer and cigarette ends on my balcony. My next room was clean and bright however the bed rock hard with pillows that were too thin. This is not a place to sleep in either as the overzealous housekeeping staff start their work early and make considerable noise in the corridors. The unhelpful reception staff continued with their surly and unhelpful manner- too many numerous encounters to list here- just be prepared to go it alone at this hotel. This hotel is located just a little too far from the tourist centre and their lack of caring and quality do not make it worth the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Floridacruiser1
Reviews.Content: We were concerned by some of the negative reviews posted after we had made our reservation. What we found was totally different. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was modern. Complimentary breakfast was served on the rooftop - a nice way to start the day. We arrived at the hotel early in the morning - well before check-in time. The hotel stored our luggage. When we returned mid-afternoon, we were given our room and our luggage was brought up within minutes of us getting in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service and not a 4* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAG068
Reviews.Content: This was my very first trip to Rome and second time for my partner and it was a real dream of mine to visit. I chose the Romanico Palace because it professed to be a really good quality 4* hotel with great service. Unfortunately we were very disappointed. The hotel emailed me two weeks before the trip to ask if we would like to uprgrade to a suite. As I had read a number of reviews saying that the standard rooms were small, I agreed to the upgrade at an additional cost. When we arrived, to say we were disappointed would be an understatement. The suite was still a very small room and not really what we had been led to believe we would get for the additional money paid. This was made worse by the fact that the shower in the bathroom was broken and whilst still functioning, the shower head would not stay upright, meaning my partner had to prop it up against the cubicle. We advised reception and they said they would send someone along to fix it. When we arrived back from our day out the following day, the shower had still not been fixed and so my partner complained again only to be told that as it was the weekend, and they needed a special part, it couldn't be fixed. My partner asked for another room and they said they would see what they could do. Needless to say, nothing else was done about this and we continued for the whole weekend with a broken shower. There is also no room service to speak of even though this is advertised in the brochure and in the descriptions on many web-sites. When we asked for this, we were told that they might be able to find a sandwich but couldn't promise. The comlimentary bottle of wine we were supposed to get with our booking didin't materialise and generally we found the staff to be completely indifferent to our not unreasonable requests. For a 4* hotel, I would expect the rooms to be fully functional, a full room service offering, (if it is advertised which it is) and for complaints to be dealt with satisfactorily which they weren't and for the staff to be polite and courteous when, in fact, on many occasions they were surly and unhelpful. I am hoping to go back to Rome again but I definitely would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not four-star quality in amenities nor service”
Reviews.Author: nagamak
Reviews.Content: I booked three nights at the Hotel Romanico Palace, but on arrival, I was told they did not have an open room. They booked us at another sister hotel (the terrible Anglo Americano) and told us to check back later that evening or in the morning to see if there was an open room. While they paid for the taxi, the fact that we had to move all our stuff, unpack and pack again was extremely inconvenient, especially for a long weekend. But we had no choice as we hated the second hotel. The concierge both times (a separate one for check-in each time) acted like they were doing us a favor and were not very gracious. I wasn't angry, nor did I complain, but a little sympathy and kindness would have gone a long way. The hotel is also quite far from anything and if you're not used to walking, taxis can get expensive after a while. If you're from NYC, the distance to the metro (Barberini) is about a ten minute walk, but a leisurely stroller will probably take 15-20 minutes (or a family). We also weren't told that breakfast was part of the stay so we missed breakfast all three days. I definitely don't think the service or the amenities warrant a four star. This is a 3 1/2 star at best and only because you have to excuse the room size for European standards. For US travelers, this is probably not even on par with a Holiday Inn. I would spring for a nicer hotel that is a little more central if you really want to relax in Rome. We were supposedly upgraded "deluxe" room, so if the regular rooms are a step down from what we got, then the hotel is likely more a 2 1/2 to a 3-star by US standards. The amenities were fine - clean bathroom (which was the best part of the room). Beds are a bit hard and the linens are definitely three star quality. Don't expect this to a heavenly bed. Very small closet and TV. The tiny balcony was cute. Our equally tiny TV was also adequate. We did not open the small refrigerator. The room had a safe, which was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A restful stay but it was the little things”
Reviews.Author: steeljammer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, well run. The room was clean and comfortable. For a 4 star hotel it was the little things on which it failed. - No means of making tea or coffee in the room - Very limited selection of channels on the TV, which didn't have a remote - No proper restaurant. They did offer a very limited and very expensive pasta with wine. - Shower cubicle didn't seal so leaked all over the bathroom floor - WiFi wasn't free and was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: travel-the-world66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I prepaid for 5 nights stay at $200/night. We were put in a room that was no better than a budget inn. The windows were not sound proof and we could hardly sleep with traffic noise. There were two twin beds pushed together to get a "king" bed. Other than fancy wallpaper, The room had very dim lighting that you can barely see anything. There were no free wifi, no lotion, no hair conditioner, no show cap, let alone other nice things that other 4-star hotels would offer. This hotel is so guest unfriendly that it puts a note in the room, stating that "It is forbidden to bring outside drink and food to the room". This is unbelievable. We have stayed in many different hotels with different star level, but this hotel is the worst for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, well located, small”
Reviews.Author: bayerischbob
Reviews.Content: Our room (and shower!) were quite small by most standards.However, everything worked well and was clean and modern. Helpful staff, and good breakfast. Room had no window, but we didn't really mind this.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt fault it, made a fantastic trip, perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Kellyd1971
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed, service was very good, staff very friendly nad helpful, breakfast was great on teh roof top overllong Rome, room lovely and very clean, and all in all really pleased with price and location which was walking distance to all attractions. Would def recommend, going to book for my mums birthday. We found it on trip advisor and we were really pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: JRC-UK-38
Reviews.Content: There were so many things wrong with this hotel that I am not going to be able to list them all here! I upgraded to a 'Prestige' double when I booked on lastminute.com as I wanted to ensure a good room for the first three nights of my holiday but what I actually received was a tiny, dated and dirty little room - two single beds pushed together to form a pretend double (seriously we almost fell down the middle a number of times!) which they had put a double sheet on to try and trick us! The TV was useless and looked over 20 years old - channels were missing and/or fuzzy! The complimentary WiFi advertised did not exist! There was no signal in the room and when enquiring at reception we were told we had to purchase tokens to use it - we then had to use the single PC provided in the bar area to actually get a connection! We were on the fourth floor which would not have been a problem had the lifts actually worked! During our stay we heard talk of other guests getting trapped in the lifts and the one time we tried to use them we were very nearly stuck ourselves (doors would not open at ground floor and after several minutes waiting we had to frantically press the buttons to try get the lift to go to an alternate floor which it eventually did and we escaped!). The kitchen was closed for our entire stay so no food was available except for breakfast which was poor! We were told to go to the restaurant around the corner (to be honest the very fact that they recommended it put us off going there!). The roof terrace advertised and which looked so lovely in the photos was closed for our entire stay! It did not look like it had been open for some time! They were clearly under staffed also as the doorman was also the barman - this meant lengthy waits at the bar for a drink and when he did turn up he did not speak a word of English so if you could not point at it you were out of luck! The receptionist kindly booked us on to an English speaking tour of the city which turned out to be a complete waste of money comprising an Italian speaking guide who did not seem to know anything at all and a very, very hot bus with no air con! We ended up leaving the tour which we had paid 100 Euros for and going it alone which worked out much better! I would not stay here again despite the good location - even if they offered me a free stay!

Reviews.Title: “a really lovely little hotel in a very pleasant spot, clean and safe.”
Reviews.Author: jojosphone
Reviews.Content: having read some of the reviews we were a little anxious abut this place. it is lovely. clean , quiet and in a very nice location. the staff were helpful and professional. we'd deffinitley go again. buy bus tickets though because there's a fair bit of walking and the city is on 7 hills(only 7?). our first visit to Rome but we would deffinitely go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic setting, Beautiful view, Great staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: BrendaLagnese
Reviews.Content: From the second you walk through the revolving doors, Simone greets you with a smile and helps your every need. The hotel is really pretty...we received a free drink upon arrival, which was nice. They also gave us a free shuttle from the airport which was about a 20 minute trip, so that was a great penny saver for us. The room was sooo romantic and decorated just like a roman palace. We had a full marble shower and a beautiful view of Rome from our window, which we could open and look out at night. We were extremely happy with the central location to the Trevi fountain and spanish steps. Our favorite was the porter Simone...he was so sweet and helpful!!!! Would highly recommend..

Reviews.Title: “A great base to see the sights and experience Rome”
Reviews.Author: westie212
Reviews.Content: Staff in general were pleasant and helpful. Our room although in a quirky place, ( in a separate apartment building next door, very 1930's which I loved). The room itself was roomy, clean, freshly decorated with a lovely shower, plenty of towels and toiletries and a fairly comfortable bed. We paid 99 euros for the room per night booking 6 months in advance. The room was titled as a junior suite with a bottle of spumante, more like a double room. The receptionist suggested we have our spumante in the bar, it was brought to us in an ice bucket with flutes, nice touch ! We found some lovely restaurants; "Otello alla Concordia" near to the spanish steps and "Wanted" just along from the colosseum. Lovely food and service. The best ice-cream we had was to your left as you face the Trevi fountain. The prices at Piazza Navona are not too bad, 15 euros for a bottle of red wine, small ice-cream 2 euros. There are alot of open top bus tour services which are great for hopping on and off. I would recommend the 110 company as their buses were more frequent and continued into the evening. Dress code in the Vatican and most churches is strict, no bare flesh, 3/4 trousers ok but no shorts. Churches seem to close early on sunday. Comfortable shoes are a must, we walked such alot in 2.5 days. Vatican 1 day, colosseum by day + by night, spanish steps by day + by night, Trevi Fountain By day + by night, Piazza Navona, Castle of Angels, The Forum, Palatine, Vittorianna Emmanuel, Bernini Piazza several times which is where we caught our tour bus. Even my comfy ecco's gave me blisters. I love the Italian culture so coupled with lots to look at we had a great time and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Rome at its best!”
Reviews.Author: moretonsuk
Reviews.Content: I had this hotel booked for me with my girlfriend for my 21st birthday. There are far too many people on this website who are expecting hotels to look like those in typical cities, if you want to holiday in true Rome, this is the place to stay. The decoration is fantastic and the rooms are clean, classic and luxurious! The position is in a good area and is within walking distance to all of the main amenities and sights. We had a room on the sixth floor with views all over Rome and a roman style Jacuzzi bath. Our trip was truly magical and would not have been without the hotel and its staff! Each day a good healty breakfast is served on the top floor where you can again see all over Rome and hear the bells on the churces ringing!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel let down by its staff and management”
Reviews.Author: pepper01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly magnificent in its decor cleanliness and the rooms are wonderful, we were on the 6th floor of the anex building next door and the room had just undergone full refurbishment. We were disappointed that we were made to wait until almost 5pm to check in as the room was not ready so we left the bags and went out as the bar was closed. Then we get to the staff, the bar is never manned and you wait for upto 15 mins for service, the rooftop bar is closed for the whole of august, it is also completely covered and not open like the pictures, you will only get one room key no matter what you say, the breakfast has nothing hot unless you like lots of toast, you can't even heat the croissant's. However as a base to explore the beautiful city of Rome it is ideal. I would rate this hotel as 2* service in a 4* hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel- book a suite with a jaccuzi- well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: klp868
Reviews.Content: Nice place, very clean. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was good and substantial. Our room had a jacuzzi in, which was perfect after a long day walking round Rome! I would return if I ever go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “hotel nightmare”
Reviews.Author: jeanp1624
Reviews.Content: This was the worse hotel we have stayed at bar none. The decor was tacky and cheap looking. The photos on the website are very mis-leading and look nothing like the real thing. we were on the 6th floor. the lift broke down and access card reader to our room did not work meaning the porter had to come with us each time we needed to go to our room. The manager was unhelpful and extremely arrogant .He never even tried to offer us an alternative room. We definitely would not recommend this hotel to anyone. location apart 2 star would be what this place deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Californiadreamin04
Reviews.Content: My two college student children and I stayed 6 days at Hotel Romanico Palace and I have mixed feelings about the hotel. We arrived approximately 90 minutes early and were told that for an additional fee we could have access to our room. We elected to wait. We had just completed a 20-hour trip and were exhausted. When we finally got to our room, not a minute before check-in time, we found two standard sized beds, not queens as I had reserved. I returned to the main desk and requested another room; the deskman gave me an unpleasant smirk and said that my room was a double queen and that no other options were available. Too tired to argue, I returned to our room for some sleep. Shortly thereafter, we heard loud banging on the door. As I got out of bed, the door opened and a man was standing in the doorway. He had somehow opened the door. He seemed as surprised as I was and ran. Once again, I visited the front desk. This time a new man was at the desk and he simply replied "impossible." Given that I had prepaid my reservation we opted to stay at Hotel Romanico, but we were cautious and used the safe religiously. We had no other problems. As for the room, like most European hotels, there is no real closet. Our room was of decent size but you had to step over suitcases to get from one side to the next. There was not place to sit in the room, other than on the beds (the small wooded chair in the room was not comfortable). The beds were rock hard, seriously. Even my college student kids who can sleep anywhere complained about their backs hurting from the rock beds! The bathroom had a clever arrangement in that there was always ample hot water and a good shower head, but the base was very shallow with a slow drain so that you were forced to turn the shower off to avoid flooding the bathroom. My dad used to call these "army showers" where you used water sparingly in an on-off fashion. Unfortunately, my son ignored this condition on several occasions. There was a sign that it is "forbidden" to bring in drinks and food from the outside. We ignored this sign. Across the street there is a nice lady who sells cold drinks and fruit as much lower prices that the hotel. The breakfast room was lovely with a view overlooking the city; the food was standard. During our stay, tour groups would be given a hot breakfast, while other guests would be limited to the continental fare. The breakfast manager would stare and seem to scowl at guests who ate too much or lingered too long. We ignored him as well. To get internet, you are required to buy a ticket, 5 Euros for an hour, if I remember correctly. The location of the hotel is a bit distant from old Rome, but within walking distance to spanish steps and Trevi Fountain. The hotel is very close to the American Embassy. Taxi to Vatican is about 15 E. The bus line stops directly across the street from the hotel and is very easy to use; bus pass for entire day is 4E. When we asked about a bus schedule, the vendor laughed and said, Rome bus-no schedule. We always felt safe walking, even very late at night. We returned to Rome four weeks after our initial stay as we were departing FCO to return home. We opted not to stay at Hotel Romanico. We chose a closer hotel that was actually not as nice. The trade-off, however, was worth it as we were more spontaneous with popping in and out of the hotel,not having to walk quite as much. My advice is that if you chose Hotel Romanico, consider making a reservation that is not prepaid to allow yourself to move if you have a problem. Hopefully, you wont and your stay will be wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING, WONDERFUL, FABULOUS, BEAUTIFUL!!”
Reviews.Author: KirklandJT
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review for anyplace.... but, I had to write one for Hotel Romanico Palace and Rome in particular. The hotel was beautiful, the staff was amazing, and location was perfect. I first researched where to stay for over a month. I looked at all kinds of reviews, the star ratings, the amenities, pictures, I even looked at the satellite views of the hotel street and ended up picking the Hotel Romanico Palace. My husband and I were celebrating our 25th wedding Anniversary, so it was special to us. Neither of us had ever been to Rome or Italy and it really wasn't the top of our list, but it was within the top 10. What a GREAT CHOICE!!! About the hotel, we were greeted with excellent English (as our Italian is very limited), a great room (looked just like some of the pictures from the website), a spotless facility, and the friendliest staff (and townspeople) that we could have ever imagined. Everyone at the hotel (and surrounding area) were so friendly. The complimentary breakfast was perfect. The in-hotel bar had excellent service, excellent English, great beverages, and a beautiful setting. Please be friendly to the bartender, he is a GEM.) The hotel is a short walk to the Via Veneto, one of the main streets in Rome. You can see the American Embasy from the back (it faces the Via Veneto). Rome (according to several reviews prior to us going, views while we were touring the city, and street views of some of the hotels before we went) has a bad grafitti problem. NOT ON OUR STREET. NOT AT THE HOTEL ROMANICO. EVERYTHING THERE WAS PICTURESQUE AND PERFECT!! We took tons of pictures of our room and from our room windows (but I won't bore you with those). PLEASE STAY HERE!! You won't regret it. (A quick side note, on one of our tours during our 5 nights here, we were asked by our tour guide where we were staying -because they drop you off back in front of your hotel when you are done -and we told her the HOTEL ROMANICO PALACE, and she said 'ooh, that's a NICE hotel! And she was sincere!) The surrounding restaurants (as there isn't one in the hotel for lunches or dinners) were out of this world. They were reasonably priced (by European standards) and the food and wine was absolutely AMAZING!!! If you get the chance to go to LA LAMPADA, please do!! We loved everything about this restaurant (it was suggested by the concierge at Hotel Romanico). We tried almost everything on the menu, and it was all FANTASTIC. We also LOVED RISTORANTE MARIANO (both restaurants are just around the corner from the Hotel -short walking distance and frequented by locals). Their Tortelini was the best I've ever eaten in my life. Someday, we will go back to Rome, we will stay at the Hotel Romanico Palace again, we will eat at La Lampada (probably many times) and Ristorante Mariano. I wished it when I went to the Trevi Fountain!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great spot from which to explore a great city”
Reviews.Author: jessicarrgh
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews about this hotel on this website i was a little apprehensive about booking a long weekend stay there. However, once i had dealt with the hotel directly and got a really good rate on a suite (due to august being considered low season) we were convinced to give it a go. The reception staff spoke perfect english and were very helpful and quick to respond to all our queries and to sort us out with a discounted price. To be frank, i really can't understand how the negative reviews of this hotel have come about. Perhaps the hotel has had a miraculous improvement in between then and the time we stayed there, or perhaps people had very different expectations to ourselves. Personally i found the staff extremely helpful and polite and any coldness people may have mentioned i think is actually a high level of professionalism in the reception staff. Of course it lacks the 'family fun' feel of other establishments but this is quite clear from the website and size of the hotel alone. The room was spotless, and cleaned spotlessly every day we were there. Our clothes we had left messy were always folded on the chair or bed. Breakfast was perfect for our needs - there was a large selection of cereals, fruits, cheese and meats, yoghurts, pastries, breads, spreads and cake. There was tea, coffee and juices too. Obviously the earlier you got there the better the selection but i did see staff topping up supplies late in the morning. If you are expecting a full english breakfast or fry up then you will be disappointed - but surely this is not the kind of breakfast you would expect in continental europe, and it certainly isn't the kind of breakfast i would want before a day of sightseeing (and as a vegetarian). The staff gave us recommendations and showed us where things were and were generally very nice and helpful. The location of the hotel is not in the middle of everything, but it is only on the very edge of the middle of everything - it is not miles out of town. It is a five minute walk to barberini where there are lots of bus stops and the metro, and another five minutes or perhaps even less to the trevi fountain area. From there the spanish steps and piazza navona/pantheon areas are within easy walking distance. Of course the walk back in the blistering sun is a little uncomfortable but it really isn't a long way to walk and you can time your day/walks around the heat easily. It also meant the area was lovely and quiet and lacking in the huge masses of slow walking tourists in other areas which meant a good night's sleep. The suite we had came with an amazing view on its terrace and even a hot tub on the terrace too (which we used cold most of the time as a very refreshing end to a long day of sightseeing). It came within our set budget of 600 euros for three nights at a centralish roman hotel and we really couldn't have asked for more. I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel,spotless room and friendly staff all contribute to a wonderful break. Joyce, Belfast”
Reviews.Author: loopy_laura_belfast
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was not that central all attractions were within walking distance or a couple of metro stops away. Room size was ok,shower was great, air con was quiet and room was cleaned everyday.Breakfast was a good selection of cereals, breads,fruit and meats served in lovely surroundings. There were a number of well priced restaurants within 5 min walk- many on Via Flavia.

Reviews.Title: “When I go back to Rome, I know where I'll be staying!!”
Reviews.Author: nollaig10225
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend stay in Rome. I brought my nephew (who is a fanatic on ancient Roman history) for his first stay in Rome and I must say the Romanico Palace Hotel helped to make the trip memorable. From check in to check out the staff were friendly, professional and courteous. The hotel is very centrally located (5 minutes walk to Metro in Barberini, 7 minutes to Republica). The room was spotlessly clean, cool (the air conditioning silently worked all the time) and the bath/shower/jacuzzi a blessing with hot water available at all times of the day. The rooftop restaurant (where breakfast is served) is spectacular (if not quite 360 degrees!). Food for breakfast is normal enough fare (cereals, fruit, cold meats, bread, juice, coffee). Sometimes despite a great venue your holiday/break can be tarnished by a poor experience/incident in your hotel. In this case however, the Romanico complemented the great City that it is located in and I would recommend it to anyone. Well done guys. Ciao, Noel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, opulant hotel, unfortunatley the atmosphere did not match!”
Reviews.Author: VFoxy
Reviews.Content: The interior design of this hotel is bautiful with plenty of antique looking furniture, opulant drapes in gold and reminders of Rome's history, including statues of gladiators and legionnaires. However; all this was not backed up with the ambiance. The staff on the whole were not helpful and did not make us feel welcome. We were not greeted with friendly faces nor were we thanked for our stay or wished a safe onward journey, infact all that was said on us checking out was how much we owed for our upgrade and mini bar. In addition, we had two days of tepid showers. On this basis we would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel situated in a busy location”
Reviews.Author: flysandy
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel not up to a 4 star rating. The shower was great and the room adequate for our needs. Good job they have double glazing given the traffic noise. Our room was situated in the annexe which on first impressions was a bit disappointing but we got used to it, The breakfast which was basic continental is served on a pleasant rooftop terrace which I think is the only highlight of the hotel. Staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “3-Star hotel on a busy, noisy street, far from major attractions”
Reviews.Author: Jim2010_10
Reviews.Content: This is a 3-star hotel at best. It is located on a busy and noisy street with buses, trucks, and motorcycles passing 24 hours a day. Don't expected to have a good sleep at night. The rooms are small, even though we had upgraded. We still had to pay more to get a slightly bigger room. The hotel is on the outskirts of central Rome and relatively far from major attractions. This is very important if you want to take a short rest in the middle of your day. The included breakfast was the bare minimum, the coffee seemed to be re-heated from the day or the night before! The hotel staff were cold and indifferent. With the same price, there are better hotel choices more centrally located for tourist attractions and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a place to crash after hours of walking around seeing the sights”
Reviews.Author: Katherine91
Reviews.Content: Went on a trip for four days (3 girls, 18 years old). Hotel was great, just what we needed. Staff were friendly, spoke very good english and were happy to help. Room were clean with.... interesting decor and not too small, perfect for a place to crash after hours of walking around seeing the sights. The hotel was well situated- a shortish walk to the nearest metro and near enough to walk to many sites such as the spanish steps. Couldn't really fault this hotel with it's great breakfast which you ate in the rooftop garden with an amazing view. Hotel food was expensive but being so near the middle of rome with plenty of places to eat it wasn't a problem. I would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “wireless not working and dirty water leak on our bed!!”
Reviews.Author: gusilei
Reviews.Content: I am Italian and my boyfriend is from NY. We stayed in Rome 3 days at the hotel Romanico Palace. The first 2 days were OK, even if the buffet breakfast offers bad and probably 1 or 2 days old pastries, the internet cost 5 euros per hour and once we bought 2 hours we discovered that in our room there was some problem with the wireless and as they did not even have the cable to connect the computer, we had to stay in the lobby to use it. The 3rd day, while we were watching TV we started getting drops of water falling on us, so we called the room service, the guy came and said he would have checked upstairs and sent someone to change the blanket. We waited 40 min, the water had stopped for a while but nobody had come nor called to follow up, so I called they said they were coming but after 2 hours, they were not there yet and the water had re-started leaking from the ceiling. So we decided that it was better to go out, we got downstairs, in quite a bad mood and asked for an explanation. It turns out that they had not even checked what was the cause of the leak(I guess they already knew) as the ppl upstairs was taking a bath and they didn't want to disturb them, they said that it was probably due to the fact that the bath tub was too full(as if it was a normal thing), so we asked what they were going to do and they said "I DON'T KNOW" and they would give us an answer once we got back from dinner. Finally they changed our room . I have traveled a lot and I have stayed even in cheap hotels in the Philippines but I have never got nor seen this way of working.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ragingbeast14
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on lastminute.com and got a very good deal on a prestige double room. I got 3 nights for the price of two. The hotel location is good but not great. The area the hotel's in is very posh and upmarket but it 's a good 10 minute walk to Spanish Steps. And about 20 - 25 minute walk to the Colosseum. There is a few restaurants near the hotel but they are abit on the pricey side. We went to the main areas of town for food. The hotel room had everything you could have wanted - Hair dryer, tv, small balcony with view, mini bar, safe, big wardrobe, sofa, hyrdo shower and air conditioning. The bed is large but isn't the comfiest and you only get one pillow each. But the room was very clean and nicely designed. The breakfast in the hotel was fine because it was included in the price so I couldn't really complain. If I had paid extra for it I wouldn't have been that impressed. It was your basic ham, cheese, jam and fruit juice, no hot food. Also the breakfast was not served on a roof top balcony. It was on the 7th floor which was indoor. Overall this is a decent hotel if you get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again - poor service!”
Reviews.Author: trontronic
Reviews.Content: When my friend and I arrived and went to have bath in the Junior Suite room allocated, it did not have hot water. A hotel plumber spent 2-3hours back and forth in the room trying to fix the problem. During this time I informed reception that I was unhappy with the service and wanted a new room I was told to wait for the plumber to fix things. After being told the issue was fixed and having to complain a third time that the problem still existed I was moved with my luggage back through to the main hotel and was offerred a dirty less appealing room. We explained the room was dirty and had black smudges and marks all over the white wall, we would accept a room of the same standard we had booked or better but the room shown was not suitable. My friend was on crutches with an injured knee and we were sent back in the lift with luggage to the other building to the original room with claims the issue had been fixed but in fact there were still problems with the water not being hot. After hours of dealing with an issue that shouldn't have occurred, finally a nicer room was offerred which had hot water but we had to pay extra to stay in it. There was a spa opposite the bed in this new room but it leaked and we spent days with towels at the base of it while we tried to avoid slipping on the wet tiles. I received much better service in budget accomodation throught Europe, I was appalled by the poor treatment and lack of service provided by Hotel Romanico. It was not a nice welcome to Rome. As far as sleep goes, in the mornings you could hear cleaners banging on doors to see if people were in there and then hallway phones ringing off the hook whilst reception try to get in touch with the cleaners. Also, beware because the price of the shuttle to the airport increased from the time I initially queried it at reception to the time I went to book it a couple days later. I would tell others to avoid this hotel if you want to have good service with warm welcome and relaxing stay in Rome, In this case you don't get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in the Via Veneto for a corner Suite with terrace and jacuzzi.”
Reviews.Author: TwoNebraskaGuys
Reviews.Content: We were trying to decide between Hotel Romanico Palace and Hotel Campo de Fiore. Both were the same price and both had balconies. We decided on Hotel Romanico Palace, even though it is not in the city center, it's only a 5-7 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, then another 3-5 minutes to the Trevi fountain from there. We booked directly through the hotel to ensure we received the exact room that we wanted (The Roman Empirial Suite). The Customer Care representatives were great in helping us book the room. The Guest relations / concierge (Iliana) was extremely helpful and courteous through e-mails. She arranged a private driver to and from the airport to hotel. She also helped arrange a bouquet of flowers that were in the room on arrival along with chilled Italian Sparking wine that was delivered to our room within minutes of checking in. She was also instrumental in answering all our questions about laptop rentals and internet access during our stay. Our luggage was brought up by the bell boy and our welcome to Rome was amazing. The huge private balcony with Jacuzzi was a joy to come home to after a long day of walking and site-seeing! I am guessing that the negative reviews on this hotel are based individuals that were booking their rooms through a bargain middle-man website. Well, you get what you pay for. If you are looking for a bargain price, then you will receive a bargain experience. We paid 300 Euros a night for the corner suite (which is a bargain) for a private terrace with a Jacuzzi. The hotel is two blocks from the Westin Excelsior and is 1/4 the price with all the luxury. The rooftop breakfast was great and it started our day off right. I cannot thank the hotel staff enough for making our first trip to Rome amazing. The entire staff was extremely helpful and spoke perfect English. We really enjoyed "La Dolce Vita" in our Roman Empirial Suite. Thanks so much Iliana!

Reviews.Title: “will not come again”
Reviews.Author: Avrom
Reviews.Content: location OK. not a modern hotel. valet parking. big room. we paid 300 euro per night. wefound it expencive for what we got. in the room there is a note that the gust are not alowed to bring any drink or food to the room. very not welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast Room”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug13Canada
Reviews.Content: Although a little off the beaten track, this hotel is in a nice, quiet location. The staff are friendly and efficient. The hotel is quaint in the public areas. The rooms are a little worn, but nice overall. Bed could use a new mattress - gave a new meaning to the word "firm". The breakfast room is a highlight. The choice of foods is very good. The room itself provides a nice view of the surrounding area and is glass enclosed for rainy days. Overall a good choice when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: ebba-lotta
Reviews.Content: After been dreaming about Rome fore a lot of years we finaly decided to spend our 25-year weddinganniversery in Rome. I carefully choose between the hotels in our pricerange and fund this. The interiour is a kitch dream in red and gold with ornaments just about everywhere. I loved it. Our room was quite small but sufficent. Even the bath was in gold and red. The breakfast room on the top floor was nice and had all that you needed exept eggs. The area was quiet and had a few restaurants close by. We ate at La Cantina just a couple of hundred meters up the street. Very nice food and wine at a reasonable cost. Highly recomended. We hade o lovely stay at Romanico Palace ebba-lotta

Reviews.Title: “What you'd imagine a beautiful Rome hotel to be...”
Reviews.Author: travelcritic22
Reviews.Content: I picked the Romanico Palace to be our first hotel in Italy because it would be my wife's first time there. It blew her away. Marble floors, untra modern at at the same style very ornate and traditional. The staff was very helpful....the lobby, rooftop breakfast room, and room were all spectacular, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough”
Reviews.Author: Steven00057
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were very friendly. The complimentary breakfast on the upper terrace was far above anything that we would have expected in the quantity of selections and quality. Our room was clean and nice enough. The location is in a quiet and lovely area and close enough to many things with a little walking. There are three things though that were cause for a bit of discomfort or inconvenience. First our room was too warm and opening the window did little to help. There is no way to adjust the temperature of the room yourself and we were told by staff that they could not change the settings either. We were there in early April so it was not because of the climate outside. Fortunately our room was an inner facing room so we could have the window open without dealing with outside noise. Secondly the WiFi service was expensive and unreliable. 10 euros for 2 hours and we had more problems logging on and even having the service up and working than I care to deal with. I had to demand new codes more than once because after paying for two hours and being logged on for only 20 minutes it would say the next time I logged on that I had like 45 minutes left! Rather sketchy I say.... When brought to the attention of the desk staff there was too much discussion before a new code for time was issued to me. Definitely sketchy. Thirdly no wash cloths were provided in the bathroom and the shower with all of it's jets had absolutely no shelf or anywhere to put your soaps and shampoo! Thus you would have to open the shower and get what you needed and put it back on the sink. That is crazy. Oh, and if you need to wake up very early you have to run the H2O for some 10 minuter before you get hot water. This was a nice enough hotel for Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Charles5333
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a few days during the Eruption. It is right nest to the American Embassy and most of the other guests were American. Rooms were adequate, modern and clean. The bathroom was very good with a multi head shower. It is in a decen location, but it is a bit of a walk to restruants and most of them are on the higher end of price. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. My only gripes are that I was unable to get an iron and ironing board, also "free" wifi is only for 1 hour. The breakfast in the restruant is worthwhile, usual continental fare, but the view from the top of the building is good. Check out lastminute.com I got really good rates compared to the rack rate. It was a bit of a joke the hotel staff could not give me the internet price but using the hotel computer I managed to book the accomodation as needed at the internet rate, print it out and then the hotel staff woudl accept it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RJC78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely! We had a 4 day trip for my husbands birthday and we were really impressed with the hotel. It is 10 minutes away from the Spanish steps which is an ideal location, the staff were fabulous after seeing the sights we spent every afternoon with a bottle of red in the bar area. We were given 3 outstanding recommendations of restaurants no more than 100m from the hotel which were all excellent I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and will definitely return on my next trip to Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “great location near spanish steps”
Reviews.Author: KJNewZealand
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great spot close the spanish steps (5-10min walk). Our hotel room was comfortable and nicely decorated, however it was too hot. Despite it only being 19'C during the day the temperature inside our room was significantly above this especially at night. The air-con would not switch on and it the main road outside made it too noisy to open the window. Unfortunately our room had pipes running down behind the wall so it was noisy when one of the other rooms ran any water. The bathroom was really nice but little touches like a shelf in the shower to put your soap or shampoo on were missing. We took to metro to the colosseum in the morning and spent the day seeing the sights and making our way leisurely back to the hotel. It was then an easy stroll back to the spanish steps for dinner. Breakfast was good with a selection of rolls, meat, cheese and jam as well as lots of cakes and pastries. The view from the roof terrace is lovely. All in all it's a perfectly good hotel to stay in, it just lets itself down on some key points and I expected better for €93 a night.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL, FRIENDLY AND CLOSE TO ALL MAJOR ATTRACTIONS”
Reviews.Author: nicwai1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Romanico Palace hotel during the Easter Holidays, 4th to 7th April 2010. Hotel is small, with friendly, helpful staff. Both public spaces and bedrooms were clean. We stayed on the 5th floor and had lovely rooftop views over Rome. Our room consisted of 2 double beds, 2 single wardrobes and a glass topped table/desk and chair. The bathroom was very small but adequate with a fabulously large shower, toilet, bidet and washbasin, there was also a powerful hairdryer in the bathroom. Across from the main bathroom in the main room area was a separate larger washbasin and another powerful hairdryer. Soap, shampoo, showercaps, shoe shines were supplied and replaced daily. Although situated on a busy main road, noise pollution was not a problem. Hotel is situated approx 10 minute walk to the Spanish steps, 15 minutes to the Trevi fountain and no more than 25 minutes to the Colosseum all by foot. There is a lovely little Spar approx 2 mins walk away where you can stock up with water and snacks etc to see you through the day as to buy these items near the main attractions is very expensive, for example a small bottle of water in the spar costs 25 cents, at the colosseum 2 euros!! Continental style buffet breakfast was served in the roof top restaurant with even better views over the City. Food choices included cereals, fresh fruit, toast, fresh rolls, yogurts, cooked meats, cheese and pastries to name just a few, and all were delicious. Tea, coffee and fresh juices were also available. Only downsides of this hotel for me were, no coffee making facilities in room and the bar/ lounge area consisted of tables and chairs in keeping with a bar/ cafe/ restaurant that is there were no comfortable chairs or settees to rest in after a long day walking the streets. Also there are no leisure facilites such as swimming pool or gym, but we knew that when we booked. Bar prices were very expensive but probably no more than in any of the restaurants or cafes in the City. I would definitely return to this hotel again and would definitely recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously beautiful, sparkling clean, bountiful rooftop breakfast with views!”
Reviews.Author: JBCritical
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Roma and the Romanico Palace Hotel did not disappoint us. The luxurious lobby had a waterfall fountain, painted murals and cushy seating. We got two rooms, one for me and my husband, and one for our two adult children. Both rooms were beautifully decorated Italian style with painted walls and furnishings. Our room had a small balcony (not all rooms do), a great view, and a fully tiled bathroom with a deep tub and a jet spray shower. After our full days of touring I completely loved soaking my feet in that tub! The bed was extremely comfortable and everything was perfectly clean which is very important to me. I booked through American Express Travel and I did email the hotel in advance to ask for rooms on the fourth or fifth floor. I did pay for the upgrade they offered but it was definitely worth it. Breakfast was included and what a way to start the day! The views from the roof are just beautiful. The staff was especially friendly and kind. The food was abundant and I ate THE MOST tender salami I have ever eaten and the plumpest freshest olives I have ever eaten. Breakfast also consisted of all you would expect (breads, cereals, juice, coffee, fruit, pastry--even cake!). The front desk was also fabulous. They spoke great english (thankfully) and were very helpful. We were told where to shop and sight-see and how to get there. The hotel is near the Villa Borghese and my husband and daughter enjoyed going there for a run at least three times. Everything else was within a moderate walking distance which we did not mind. We had drinks at the hotel lounge which was very comfortable, beautiful and relaxing. It was a fabulous experience and since we threw coins into the Trevi Fountain we know that someday we will return to Roma and the Romanico Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel - Would return when next in Roma!!!”
Reviews.Author: JDKELLS
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel which provides a very good service to guests. Above average cleanliness in rooms and the continental buffet breakfast in the rooftop restaurant was a great start to our day's sightseeing. If i had one complaint - bar prices were steep at €12 for a decent brandy!! - Irish guests be warned!! Would definitely recommend the hotel to a friend though – it’s two blocks from Via Veneto and rates are approx. half of those on that Street. johndalykells@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “great location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dj1404
Reviews.Content: if you want to see all of the sights be close to all the great places to eat without being in the throng of it all - this is a great hotel location. Our room was lovely and very clean. Great selection for buffet breakfast on the roof top terrace and very helpful staff. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it is described”
Reviews.Author: EssexHappytravellers
Reviews.Content: On check in we were told that there was a problem with our standard room and that we were being upgraded to a "luxury" room free of charge. This "luxury" room was in a seperate residence just along the street and appeared to be a standard apartment converted into 3 very small hotel rooms overlooking the busy main street. Room was small and "luxury" feature was simply an MDF surround over top of bed painted to look "classical" .Sounds of building work in neighbouring apartment from 8am. Roof top restaurant was nice but breakfast menu was limited even though it was buffet style. Good for a break, but not as good as its website portrays.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kbtunstall
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome so we had no idea what to expect. It's a great hotel - fully recommend it. It's suitable for couples and families or even business travellers. We were really pleased with the hotel. The staff were so helpful and courteous right from the moment we arrived - we were made very welcome. The hotel is in a good central location - about 15 minutes walk from the train station and just 10 minutes from the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. The Colloseum took us about 20 minutes and the Vatican City can easily be reached by Metro. There were some good restaurants nearby and a small supermarket just across the road. The hotel was lovely and clean, and decorated in typical Italian decor. We had a double superior room which had fantastic panoramic views across the City and even had a Jacuzzi bath on the balcony! The room was quiet considering it's location. Breakfast is served on the roof top terrace which is completely enclosed in glass - a lovely sunny room, again with beautiful views. A good selection of meats, cheeses, cereals and breads, fruit, tea coffee etc are served. Room service was prompt and efficient. I would fully recommend this hotel based on the staff alone! Everyone was so polite and cheerful - they made us really feel at home - a big thank you to you all for making our first stay in Rome so memorable... we shall recommend you to all our friends and hope to return one day!

Reviews.Title: “Thieves!!”
Reviews.Author: k95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Romanico Palace last week and my mother had over $200 stolen from the safe in her room! When she returned to her room one afternoon, she couldn't open her safe. When she called the front desk they sent up an employee (bell boy) to open the safe using an "emergency code". When the gentleman left, she noticed her money missing (not saying he stole it, but someone had stolen it earlier which is why the code had not worked for her)! She immediately went down to the front desk to tell the staff. The staff was shocked but each time we mentioned it the response was, "No one has the code but you and the man working the front desk who has an emergency code." Well, OBVIOUSLY the gentleman who came to open the safe for my mother had the universal emergency code and I'm sure most every employee has had to use it a time or two. My mother asked to speak to the manager over the next three days we were there, but he was never around (apparently) when we were in the hotel, so he left a message with the front desk saying....you guessed it...."No one has that code but you." ARGHH!! No apology, no responsibility, no compensation, not even the descency of contact from the manager. We paid for two rooms for five nights and were treated very rudely. We had other issues as well...room keys not working and wifi not working (paid for it and were never able to use it and never reimbursed -they claimed it was a problem with our computer even though others were having trouble), never an apology for any inconveniences but more of an attitude of, "Here's the squeaky wheels again!" whenever we approached. Believe me, I don't like to be a squeaky wheel. I hate confrontation and I try my best to find the positive in every situation...especially while I'm trying to enjoy my vacation. But this was RIDICULOUS and completely unprofessional! The staff were amiable and very helpful until we complained about the stolen money on the second day. The rest of the trip we felt like we needed to carry with us all our valuables. I was even afraid to leave my laptop, but couldn't manage lugging it through Rome. Not a comfortable situation. I would NEVER recommend this hotel. I'm doubtful there was any type of investigation to find the staff member that had stolen from my mother, so whose to say who'll be stolen from next!

Reviews.Title: “Thankyou for making our 1st trip to Rome a memorable one”
Reviews.Author: cuddles6610
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the Hotel Romanico Palace for making our 1st stay in Rome a wonderful experience. The hotel was perfect and the staff were absolutely wonderful, they were both helpful and extremely polite. The breathtaking views from the rooftop terrace where breakfast was served were amazing. we will be recommending you to all our friends and hope to return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, but double check what your room includes!”
Reviews.Author: manic_teen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and had a great experience. All the staff were very friendly and reception helped us on many things, from telling us which buses took us where to booking a visit to the Borghese villa! Breakfast was great, served on the enclosed roof terrace with a great selection of food! We booked a deluxe double room, which was nice and spacious with a marble floor. The only negative thing I can say about the hotel is that I emailed to check that our room would have a bath in it, and was told that it could. I took this to mean that because I booked and emailed in advance (6 months ago) and requested it, it would be included. Although when we got there our room only had a shower, and we were told that no rooms with baths were avaliable. Apart from this huccup the hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: IrelandCleo
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with standard of hotel. Rooms spotless, quiet, and very comfortable. Staff courteous and helpful. In a very nice area about 15 minutes walk from main train station. Managed to walk to all the sites, the furthest being the Vatican about 45 minutes walk away. Breakfast plentiful and served in lovely roof top terrace. Good value for money, providing you don't want too many drinks in the bar which was expensive. Would highly recommend this hotel, and would definitely stay again if I return to Rome. Amazing city!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: samjosh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this fab hotel for two nights. The bedroom was lovely and we even had a jacuzzi bath. We met some lovely people in the bar and had a great night. The hotel is within walking distance of all the top sightseeing sights. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service with a very warm welcome.”
Reviews.Author: Thebigdippers
Reviews.Content: We were on the 5th floor, away from much of the noise of Rome traffic. We had 2 rooms next to each other and they were both beautifully appointed! Especially Mums bathroom with it's mosaic sunken bath with the huge square shower-head over it - very luxurious. Our shower was huge with jets, enormous shower-head and separate hose shower! Breakfast was on the 7th floor roof terrace presided over by the lovely maitre d' who ensured that everything ran like clockwork. The selection was fantastico! Everything from a glass of prosecco through to olives and fennel. Homemade cakes, croissants, doughnuts, freshly made bread, yoghurts, fruit, meats ,cheeses you name it, it was there! The reception was friendly and very efficient. Great bar. Great location, 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, close to Villa Borghese and very close to Via Veneto. Not far from the main Termini train station which was very handy! A great central place to stay for a few days in Rome, or even just for the night!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: dotaherne
Reviews.Content: Stayed in romanico palace hotel recently and found it to be of excellent quality. The staff were extremely helpful and couteous nothing was too much trouble a map was produced on arrival of all the sights in rome {brilliant}. Rooms were checked every day and bed linen changed ,breakfast in the rooftop restaurant was continental but sufficient and the views breath taking,there was 10 of us altogether and no complaints and as for the pina colada's I can still taste them Mmm......

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel very clean very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: babsnjohn25
Reviews.Content: Hi we stayed at this hotel for three nights, for our silver wedding annivesary. had lovely room, very clean and all staff very helpful and friendly. breakfast was very good in roof -top restaurant.staff had good english if you needed to ask any advice. we were very pleased and location was very easy for walking to restaurants and shops,and metro near by for short trip to colosume and vatican city.. highly recomend this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Romanico is a clean, comfortable and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyawayIreland
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner spent 4 nights in the Romanico in late February 2010. The hotel is furnished so typically Italian which we loved. The bedroom was super clean and the daily cleaning was to a very high standard ( was like returning to a freshly made room every day). All the staff we encountered were extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel always smelt so nice! The roof terrace is a breathtaking place to have your breakfast with panoramic views of the area. The continental breakfast has everything one could possible desire. My only 2 complaints are minor. We had to ask for 2nd pillows as there was only one per person in the room and no spares were available in the wardrobes. However the staff were v prompt in obtaining more pillows for us. If you are like me and enjoy a nice hot cup of tea in the morning, you will be very disappointed as they do not have a geezer producing constant hot water but instead just pour boiling water into a metal type canister. I did not get hot tea one of the four mornings that I was there. This was the only let down for me!! You are a 7 minute walk to Barberinin Metro which will bring you swiftly to all the sites, and some such as Trevi Fountain are only a 10 minute walk from the Romanico. I would definitely re-visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “not nearly as bad as some of the review made out”
Reviews.Author: backup1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Romanico I too was worried about this hotel after seeing the reviews from other people. I made the booking with Last Minute and pay about £360 for 2 nights and flights with BA from Gatwick. I sent a number of emails to the hotel expressing my concerns and they were all answered straight away from the hotel. I did decide to pay an extra 25 Euros per night to get us upgraded to a Deluxe room which put us on the 5th floor. The room was fine, a little gaudy but I think this is the norm for a lot of the hotels. The advertised price for the night was a massive 1450 Euros which if I had paid that I would have been upset. In our room we had a good bath and a good power shower. The breakfast for typically continental and enjoyable. I can't believe some people are complaining about the TV stations, why would you want to watch TV when you're in Rome! The location of the hotel is good. It took about 5 mins to walk to the Metro and a further 5 mins to Spanish Steps. |Rome itself is expensive but this has a lot to do with the Euro. We had an excellent meal just around the corner from the hotel where we paid 80 Euros for loads of food and a good bottle. It is on Via Campinia and is called il Pomodorino. Hardly any tourists in there, just full of Italian families. I love Rome and on balance the hotel was great value. The flights would have cost about £100 each so if you pay £210 for 2 people for 2 nights in the close to the centre of town i think you have a good deal. Some of the other reviewers should be realistic. I have stayed in loads of hotels in London which cost a lot more and the service and facilities have been terrible. If you want 5 star treatment you will have to pay for it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ameleics1
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews about this hotel, I was slightly worried about the fact that some people had been moved to the hotel next door or to a different hotel entirely. As I had booked this as a surprise for my boyfriend's birthday, i decided to e-mail the hotel to express my concerns. I was told that this would not be a problem and that I would definately be staying in the hotel romanico palace. Well I was not disappointed!! When we got to the hotel we were taken straight to our room which was even better than expected. I booked a double deluxe room which was stunning and we also had a gorgeous terrace and huge doors that led onto it. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Location was very good, just a 2 minute walk to via veneto and all its bars and restaurants and not far from other sites. We also got a very good price on easytobook.com which has a very wide range of hotels all around the world. Overall we were very pleased with this hotel and would definately recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lilemski
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my Birthday in Feb with my partner, Hotel was very nice and worthy of a brilliant review. Friendly and helpful staff, gave us a map and showed us where the hotel was on map and recommended routes to follow on foot to various attractions. Good location, need comfortable shoes as lots of walking. We walked everywhere and found that its all easy to get too as long as you don't mind walking. After long day, nice to come back to this lovely hotel. Room was good size and bathroom had hairdryer and power shower. Flat screen TV with few limited English channels, BBC news, but who needs TV when your in ROME. Breakfast has lots of opions and served between 7.30 and 10.00 so you can have sort of a lie in. Would recommend Hard Rock Cafe, just around the corner, great cocktails. Would recommend pre booking a taxi as we got a taxi from airport and charged 60 euro, think you can pre book for both ways at a total fo 80 euro. Hotel arranged taxi for departure, this was a private car and was very luxurious, wished I has contacted hotel first and arranged this for arrival. All in all, this was a excellent hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and our time in Rome. I too was feeling anxious after reading mixed reviews, but you won't know unless you try.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: abld2010
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from our trip to Rome. Arriving at the Romanico Palace, we were disappointed instead to be checked into the adjoining Veneto hotel (apparently the two hotels are now owned by the same people after a bereavement). We were originally told that there was no space in the Romantico Palace. Our room in the Veneto was of considerably lower standard than we were led to believe, with two single beds pushed together and a very small bathroom (there are other clear distinctions between the two hotels, including the prices quoted at the different Reception desks - as there are still two separate ones - and the fact that guests at the Veneto are not entitled to the roof-top breakfast - something that as guests who'd paid for a room in the Romantico Palace we had been promised through your website. On the second morning, I complained again, and we were moved into the Romanico 'side' of the premises (contradicting what we were told previously) but still in a room of lower standard than the one advertised. After a further complaint, we were upgraded to a juinior suite and told that we would have to pay the difference (which was 30 euros an evening). Ultimately, I refused to pay the extra, and the hotel manager did agree to waive this. Management at the hotel were at best unco-operative and at worst dis-honest in the way they dealt with us. At times, this experience severely affected the enjoyment of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_dk
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Termini and easyly found the hotel. the chek in was fast and very friendly. We where shown our room - nice and comfortable on the second floor. Of course you can hear the traffic but if you want to stay in central Rome that's part of the package. The breakfast was really fine. There was everything you could wish for in an italian breakfast and excellent service from the frienly staff. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpfull when we needed their help and we will definitly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “It`s ok but not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: AndreyK3
Reviews.Content: Regular European hotel, small of course. Service , khm, I would rate it 2 stars for U.S. standard.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: stuee1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Romanico Palace in late January 2010 for five nights. We stayed on the third floor in a standard double room, which was very pleasant. The room is decorated in Venetian style, clearly had the "changing rooms treatment" (i.e. reproduction / immitation furniture) but functional and attractive. The room would probably be too small for a longer stay, but suited us, Bathroom is a good size, although the shower cubicle was quite small. The room also comes with a fridge (mini-bar) and electronic safe. Room is cleaned each morning to a very good standard. Very friendly and helpful staff. The buffet breakfast is well worth having. There is a selection of meats, cheese, rolls, pastries, cakes, cereal, fruit, yogurt. You can really stuff yourself ready for the day ahead! One thing I must comment on is the lovely smell in the reception area. They have some kind of scent infusing the reception and it is soooo nice. Location is not bad. It is within easy walk of the Termini Station (about 12 minutes), also about 15 minutes from the Spanish Steps and say 20 mins from the Trevi Fountain. Piazza Bernini is about 10 mins walk away and has plenty of restaurants and coffee bars. The hotel seems to be located in a banking and Embassy district, so is clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed forever!”
Reviews.Author: Bristol_where2next
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Romanico Palace for 2 nights at the end of January. When we arrived, well before check-in time, we were shown to the bar for our welcome drink (free as part of a package we’d booked)– a good choice was available (what better way to start your trip than with a glass of bubbly?). We managed to check in to our room early, and the staff were very helpful. The first thing you notice walking into the hotel – apart from a cute fountain and lots of opulent furniture is the fabulous smell – they have scented oils which are very rich and spicy – wish I could have taken it home with me! The room was fantastic – everything was clean and there was a good selection of toiletries and even slippers! The room had aircon/heating. We were staying in a junior suite –well worth the upgrade for the pleasure of the spa bath – slow to fill and empty but then when you see the size of them it’s not very surprising (you could comfortably fit in 6 people if you were that way inclined!!). We booked a special package through the hotel which included a massage each – she came to our room and we both had a 1 hour massage – bliss. We also had a bottle of wine included in the package – admittedly the staff had forgotten this, but when we pointed out their error they were very quick to rectify it – we came back to the room after dinner (in a restaurant around the corner – recommended by the staff and very nice ) to a bottle of bubbly on ice! Breakfast was good – a nice selection of meats, cheeses, fruits and pastries. As other reviewers have said they started clearing away at 10 – but then breakfast FINISHES at 10, so if you rock up then you won’t get any. In the mornings we managed to peak into some of the rooms the staff were cleaning and they looked fabulous too. I am so sad to read all the bad reviews of this place – we had a fantastic time and will hopefully be staying here again soon. The rooms, staff, ambience, breakfast, even the lift were amazing. I cannot find fault at all – except in myself for only staying there for 2 nights – I could have stayed forever!

Reviews.Title: “4 star? Not!”
Reviews.Author: MarcosNYC
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at what I thought was the Hotel Veneto based on web reviews but instead we were put in a room at the Romanico. The room was small and sparse and when we complained we were told that it was the best they had. The chaise/sofa was not anywhere I would want to sit but the beds were clean and clean towels were provided every day. We would have appreciated a few simple ammenities like a clock and some tissues, especially the tissues since they would have come in handy when we ran out of toilet tissue. There was a constant sound of dripping water and we could not figure out where it came from. The room was on the first floor facing a busy street but coming from NYC we are used to street noise, perhaps other travelers would have a problem with it. The hotel is located in a safe area, a ten minute walk to the metro and buses and taxis are a minute's walk away. Most of the staff is very friendly and attentive but one desk clerk in particular looked like he had never cracked a smile in his entire life. Would I stay there again? Don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “UNJUSTLY Bombarded With Negativity -Tips and Opinions From a Travel Professional”
Reviews.Author: mattmc1976
Reviews.Content: I work in the travel industry and countless people (both travelers AND travel-agents who are booking itineraries for their clients) rely on and value my opinion, so I hope this review will offset some of the negativity by helping you decide if Romanico Palace is what you are looking for. I apologize for the lengthy review, but in my opinion, it deserves much better ratings! When selecting hotels for international leisure travel, we look for the more quaint boutique-style properties that feature ambiance and local-charm. We prefer to stay away from the chain-properties as the rooms tend to be identical regardless of the country (or continent for that matter) where it is located. Romanico Palace was not my first choice nor was it the hotel that I had originally booked. I had been debating between Romanico and another boutique property which received MUCH HIGHER ratings; and that was the deciding factor for originally booking at another hotel. I presented my dilemma to a few colleagues who had inspected the Romanico a couple months earlier commented that it was not a bad choice. About a month after making the reservation, I switched to the Romanico Palace, and neither I nor my traveling-companion regret the last-minute decision to switch to Romanico. Upon check-in, Alesio showed us to room #416, a Junior Suite. It was of decent size and had additional features not found in the lower room categories, notably 2 small city-view terraces and a large jacuzzi-tub. Decor was just as shown on their website; classical with a touch of elegance - not at all gaudy or "over-the-top" which is sometimes common in boutique Italian hotels. Since rooms vary in size and features from one to another in most boutique hotels, Ilaria took time from her busy schedule to show me several other rooms in different categories. This tour (an opportunity that most guests wouldn't receive nor request)combined with our personal experience makes it possible to site and clarify biased complaints from others reviews: LOCATION - Rome is a large city, so no particular area is a "central walking distance" to all parts of the city. Romanico is in an excellent location as we walked on different occasions at a leisurely pace to Via Veneto in 5 minutes, Spanish Steps in 10 minutes, Trevi Fountain in 15 minutes, Ancient Rome in 20 minutes and the Colosseum in just under 30 minutes. We didn't attempt to walk to sites on the other side of the Tiber River, in particular the Vatican, as this would have taken too long. Many travelers ask to be close to the Vatican and I wouldn't recommend this unless they plan on spending ALL of their time there as a taxi would be necessary to get to the majority of other places-of-interest. RECEPTION/CONCIERGE - All employees were professional and courteous, notably Ilaria and Alesio. Everyone we came into contact with was knowledgeable and did their part to ensure that our stay was comfortable and all needs were met, even on a couple late-nights when we returned to the hotel at 3AM. Check-in is 2PM, however, early check-in is available for 25EURO which is something unique as many hotels require booking the room for the previous night to guarantee an early check-in. If you arrive before 2PM as we did, the hotel will securely store your luggage. Rome city tours, as well as day tours to other areas (Naples/Pompeii, Assisi, Florence, etc) can be booked at the front-desk. They can also make dining reservations at a quality restaurant serving authentic Italian right next-door (sorry I don't remember the name.) The food was superb and hotels guests receive a discount. ROOM FEATURES AND AMENITIES - In my opinion, the most comfortable and highest quality rooms were the Deluxe category. They were larger and better maintained than the standard category (which which were most likely the rooms that received complaints in previous reviews.) All rooms were of average size for European hotel rooms, slightly smaller than US standards. All featured private bath with tub/shower combos, hairdryer, bath-products and ample high-quality towels. We never had an issue with hot water, even with a large jacuzzi-tub. Safe and Minibar were in all the rooms stocked with water, soda, beer, wine and alcohol. Prices were not at all inexpensive, typical for a hotel minibar - you are paying for convenience. Each room has a flat-screen television with cable - only 1 station is in English, Al Jazeera news - but I have to ask why TV channels in English are of significant importance on vacation in a foreign country? You are in Rome and you could spend a month here and still not see all the sites! Wireless Internet is free on the public computer in the lobby and available for a fee in your room, purchased from the front desk. Beds were comfortable and featured clean, quality linens. Some rooms featured a queen-size bed, but most were two twins which are pushed together for guests requesting one bed as is standard in Europe. Housekeeping did a great job keeping the room clean and tidy daily. Room-service menu features breakfast, lunch and dinner. BREAKFAST - Served in the "Roof Garden" on the top floor with wall to ceiling windows with 360 degree views of the eternal city. Better than continental but typical Italian/European and featured numerous breads and pastries, various fruits, dry cereals, ham, salami, various cheeses, juice and milk. Bacon and eggs available for a fee (again, standard across Europe.) Espresso is also available for a fee, and I must note, THE BEST cappuccino we had in Italy was here! PRICE - Depends on how you make your reservation. Remember when booking on the major hotel booking-engines that focus on offering (possibly guaranteeing) the lowest price - YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!
