They are notorious (on ALL the hotels they offer, not just Romanico Palace) for reserving the least-expensive rooms which of course will be the least-desirable, possibly very small in size, undesirable view, in need of renovation, etc. I recommend booking on the Romanico Palace website OR with a reputable agent/tour operator where you will receive the most "preferred" rooms at a better price than many other comparable boutique 4 star hotels in Rome. This will also guarantee that you won't be bumped or moved to another property because of over-booking (booking more rooms than are available to guarantee maximum occupancy in the event of last-minute cancellations.) Whether right or wrong in your opinion, the airlines are notorious for it and its also a common practice with hotels. CONCLUSION - If you are looking for a 5 star luxurious hotel or for a room similar to what U.S. hotel chains offer (lacking Italian ambiance) Romanico will probably not be right for you. If you want to wake up and open your eyes and truly feel that you are in Rome, and you are seeking a full-service 4 star, more intimate hotel with great customer-service, convenient location and clean, comfortable and elegantly decorated rooms, Romanico Palace will create the perfect "Rome Experience!"

Reviews.Title: “Ok, not as bad as everyone makes out...”
Reviews.Author: zooloo83
Reviews.Content: Before I booked this hotel I went through agonising debates with myself whether I should stay or not after reading the negative reviews of this hotel. I decided to contact the hotel directly and I emailed them all my concerns. Ilaria the customer service rep, was very attentive and answered all of my (many) questions. Because she took the time to answer and the marginal discount she gave me, I decided to go ahead and take the risk! My main concerns were, the customer service, room size /views and distance and ease to look at all the attractions. Ill review each of these one by one.. Customer service As expressed earlier Illaria was very good at replying to all my emails and assured me that we would have no problems, she also reduced the price of the room for me by a marginal amount. When I reached the hotel, the staff were very attentive and formal. They were not rude at all. They were very helpful and I particularly liked the fact that they were able to call taxis for you very quickly, no waiting around at all. One negative point was that I had to remind them that we had welcome drinks as part of package, as when we got to our room they still had not asked or given us anything. They then brought the drinks up. But that is the only flaw with their customer service and Im sure Illaria will take note and fix this for the future. Room size We were give a persitge room, which supposed to have good views of the city and the jucuzzi. The room and bathroom size was ok, not very big, but I think this is probably the case for most hotels in Rome. My hubsand enjoyed the jucuzzi, so a good feature if you are tired after sight seeing and want to relax. The views however were not that great. Our room was like on the corner of the hotel, so as soon as you open your curtains you can see scaffolding and building work of another hotel, not the views they had advertised. I did express this to the staff, however she then said that this is the kind of view from most of the windows, unless you are on the top floor terrace eating breakfast. So after this experience, I would say do not not get too bothered about booking a room with a great view, as to be honest its in a built up area, so you will not be able to see the rest of the city. Distance to station The hotel is a nice place called Via Veneto. There are quite a few places to eat there, I didn't get a chance to try any restuarant properly on the stretch though. We had drinks at one bar and the drinks were very expensive like 10 euros for a non alcoholic cocktail. Walking to the station is not bad, as its down a hill and it took 15 minutes to walk. It is not 5 minutes or 10 minutes, its definately a good 15 minute walk! Also the spanish steps is about a 25 minute walk. So make sure you have some comfortable trainers, I didn't take them, so I ended up getting taxi's a bit too often! Walking back from the station was a bit difficult after sight seeing, as its up hill. Ermmmmm what else.... Breakfast on the terrace, I noticed before booking this hotel that there are a few other hotels that do this anyway. With this hotel there is a view, but not something that I would rave about. The breakfast is ok also and acceptable. Overall I would recommend this hotel to people, as the customer service was good, however don't get too excited as it is overall average once you get over the alfresco headboards!

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay, and the staff provided excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: StLTraveler12
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The location was very convenient, the rooms were nice, and the staff was excellent. We contacted them by email before we arrived, and they helped us arrange New Year's Eve plans, airport shuttles, and upgraded rooms. They even recognized our name from the emails when we checked in. They helped us with getting around the city, and gave us some excellent restaurant suggestions nearby. The rooms were clean and well-decorated, the bathrooms were great, and the complimentary breakfasts were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant...so perfect”
Reviews.Author: MrsP79
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Romanico Palace for our 1st wedding anniversary and we can't say enough how much we enjoyed it. On our arrival, they had noted that we were on our anniversary and offered to upgrade us to a suite for a minimal sum. We were shown the suite and were absolutely convinced to do it! The suite was amazing, with a jacuzzi bath and the most beautiful decor. The hotel lobby and bar was also equally beautiful, and the breakfast (which is served on a roof terrace) was lovely, with a stunning view and great cappucinos. The staff were all so friendly and couldn't be more helpful. The Customer Service Manager, Ilaria (who arranged our upgrade) was patricularly lovely. The location for seeing Rome is just just perfect, and everything was in walking distance. Overall, we couldn't recommend the hotel enough...definitely worth a stay, especially if you're looking for an opulent romantic break!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a very Italian experience!”
Reviews.Author: i_need_a_h0l
Reviews.Content: This is a very charming hotel - which gives a very Italian experience. The decor is very classic but we loved it - you can stay in a stark modern hotel anywhere. DEFINITELY worth requesting a room on the 4th or 5th floor. Yes its noisy but its a capital city so you're gonna get some traffic! We had a deluxe double room, with a nice spa bath and huge shower. the only downside was that the 'double' bed was actually 2 singles together, so alternate mornings myself or my partner would end up with a leg/arm down the crack! Not the biggest room in the world but it didnt really need to be. Very clean. The best thing about the hotel is the location - just off the Via Veneto and close to Villa Borghese and the spanish Steps. Rome is very walkable anyway and there are some lovely restaurants close by if you dont want to walk as far in the evening. The breakfast was lovely, lots of beautiful fresh continental food and lots of choice, and the views from the roof top terrace were gorgeous. Definitely worth getting breakfast or getting it included with your package. The staff were very friendly and gave us a complimentary bottle of wine as it was our birthdays while we were there, a nice personal touch. All in all we were very glad we picked it - got a good deal through lastminute.com and it was worth what we spent. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again and certainly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: artifice516
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying her with my mother and sister. We booked a vacation through travelocity and this came up as one of the hotels that fit our price range. Will comment on the things i think are most important when traveling. Location of Hotel to Cost of Hotel comparison: In a city like Rome that is very easy to navigate by train, bus or taxi, i like to find a less expensive hotel that may not be centrally located, in Rome say near the Piazza Novona, but rather something a train stop or walk away from where the city center is. Lets face it, this is not a city that requires you to go back to your hotel multiple times a day. So considering that, i loved the price and location of the hotel. Its within a short walk of the Spanish Steps and the Spagna stations, the central Termini station as well as Piazza Republica. So there are certainly things close by to start your day of sightseeing. The Villa Borghese, a must see in Rome for instance. THe only negative, not a convenience "bar" or place to buy a late night snack or something after returning from a day out. But there are certainly restaurants and we did find a nice little place to get some snacks a few blocks away after being there a few days. Hotel Staff and Accommodations All spoke English and had our names and room correct when we arrived. Were a pleasure to deal with and very polite. The best thing is the buffet breakfast that was included with our room. Not sure if this is always free but damn it was worth it! I love breakfast, so to have a nice spread of bread, meats, cereals, coffee, fruit and espresso all at your pleasure was just perfect. There is also an outdoor (it was covered when we were there) that overlooks the city. Eating a free breakfast, drinking my 2nd free espresso while watching the sunrise in Rome was a great way to start the day. You can buy other things like eggs and hot meats, but that would probably make you an idiot considering the amount of food you have out there for free. One downfall is that you have to pay for internet in the lounge area and no free wifi!!! I hate this!!! When will hotels catch on and realize that people need the web and hate to pay for it. Had to shell out 5 euro for an hour, which isnt that much i guess, but i would have loved to sit down with a coffee, turn on my phone and check my emails in the morning before heading out without paying 5 euro. Room Cleanliness and Size Ok the size was not all that impressive. It was in fact enough, dont get me wrong, but if you like a lot of room with a couch or a lounge chair, my room did not have. We had a room with 2 queens so possibly this is why. The room we had was enough however, we were not cramped by any means. Very high ceilings help it feel large also. The bathroom was rather small. I didnt really mind because i am not fat and im a dude, but my mom and sister (both not fat) did think it was a little small. The bright side is that that the water was great and powerful and there was this little bench built into the tub....let you sit down and relax a little bit while the water came over you, pretty cool. The ladies also complained about not having space to "put on there face", meaning they needed more space to put there make up. The hotel staff cleaned up the place nice every day and nothing was missing. The rooms were decorated real nice with a fake fresco style on the walls. The rest of the room was detailed in a classical way as well. My mom really liked it and thought it looked like royalty. Ok so overall i certainly like the place. I am an open minded person and have traveled a lot, so for me to recommend a hotel should mean something. Again i would say that in a city like Rome, when you should be out doing cool things and sightseing, the Hotel should not be that important. Considering the price, location, friendliness of the staff and the breakfast...this place is great. Good luck and enjoy Rome!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!TRUST ME!OVERBOOKED US AND PUT US IN A CLOSET OVERLOOKING A TRASH DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: itsmycheese
Reviews.Content: This Hotel killed me, almost! We got there after a long travel on the train. My fiance and I were over joyed. I had done a ton of research and had read a lot of good things about this hotel. We got there and to our surprise they apologized and said they had overbooked. I made my reservations 6mths in advance! So i was pretty sure they would figure it out. I don't know whether this is a scam they have worked out with a sister hotel or what but, they said they would relocate us to a hotel that was just as nice and in the neighborhood. So we reluctantly agreed. We got in the cab and rode for close to 15mins, outside of the city walls to an ugly area with a horrible looking hotel we went inside and it was filled with tons of tourist and horrible 80's decor the room was like a hostel. We called Romanico Palace and demanded a refund or for them to find us a room. We went back and they had a room for us on a bottom floor overlooking the air conditioners and the trash cans! PLEASE do not make the mistake we made. It took half the day , that we could have been enjoying Rome! I would have much rather been drinking Proseco at the Trevi fountain.

Reviews.Title: “booked this from lastmin.com good location”
Reviews.Author: holden73
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean staff pretty good & friendly, the room we had was not one in any of the phots on their web site and was average bathroom very small and there was limited space for cloths in the room. the breakfast was average we had other meals out drinks in the hotel where priced the same as bars outside the hotel the hotel is local to most attractions withi easy reach by foot Becareful getting taxis from the airport one wanted to charge us 120 euro average cost is 50 to 60

Reviews.Title: “search veneto Hotel, as thats where you'll end up!!!”
Reviews.Author: caznananna
Reviews.Content: We booked the Romanico Palace with last min, we looked at the descripton and photos and thought wow! Well it couldnt have been less wow when we got there!!! First room was TINY!!! with a ram shakle shower that had a broken gate type thing over a hole in the floor!! and as for the balcony...try a ledge with a iron fence!! we complained and the concierge told us that was the last room , when we went back we realised that it wasnt even the same hotel it was the hotel next door , the Veneto!! You will spot this for your reference , as soon as the bell boy takes you , if you go past the first set of lifts past the bar down one small flight of stairs and up another , you are in Veneto! We went back and complained after standing watching him check in several other people after he had said there were no more rooms avialble and at that point he had to conceede and offer us another room which he said was the suite.......... Well it was still in the other Hotel, it was comical!! It had slopped cellings that you would hit your head on, one window with black out blind so no light in the room , the view was of the scaffholding on the oppersti buliding which also made a LOT of noise! The Air con didnt work , apparently even if the weather is warm and your room is stuffy tough! they still will not switch it on! Our tv only had one English channel , ironically it was the only channel that did not work! The room key that you put in to activate the electrics was hilarous! you could open or close the door whislt it was in!!! as it was not enough space between the door and the key!!! As for Bath tun ...nope! not one did I see and a couple we met said theres had gunge coming out the holes, when we asked for a room with a bath the guy on the front desk said you dont want one, none of them work!! there was no balcony in our room ethier not even a ledge! There was holes in the celling of our room and the "double bed" was too singles pushed together. I was so disapointed by this hotel , it was my brithday weeekend and was supposed to be specail , frankly it was ruined by this Hotel! I would never stay there again!!!!!!! My advise is if the bath tub is whats selling it to you , dont bother ,because you wont get one and if you do its unlikey to work!! get your act together Romanico, if you cant offer the rooms you promise dont advertise them , oh and advise your staff not to give rooms based on what they think they can get away with , which is what the guy on reception of the Veneto told us they do!!! nightmare place, book somewhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Room was not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Amy0101
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night stay here and overall were not exactly bold over with the Romanico Palace. On a good note, the location was very good although you probably could get slightly better for your money, the bar and entrance of the hotel were nice enough and the staff recommended a really good restaurant, most of the staff were very helpful. Maid service was good also but must be done before 2pm. Bad side- On arrival we were given the option of upgrading which would cost up to 150 euro extra per night. I decided as my partner and I were there to see Rome and not spend time in the hotel that we would not take the upgrade and spend our money seeing the sites etc instead. I thought we had paid quite a lot for the hotel anyway so was suprised to see that our room was very dated and quite scruffy. There was a very strong smell of damp and the spa bath had a lot of mould on the jets and generally looked very old. The electric tripped out when I used the hairdryer and we had to put the trip switches up (which were outside the room) ourselves once we discovered them as no one answered the phone at reception. The electrics as a whole look very old and a bit hazardous. As previous reviews have mentioned no iron in the room or available at all. My real issue was with the air con. I have heard that Italian hotels don't like using the air conditioning, for cost reasons I should imagine, but this hotel is on quite a busy road and when we stayed there were road works going on and scaffolding being put up so there was a lot of noise. I called the reception and asked if they could come and see what was wrong with the air con unit as there was no air coming out despite it being switched on. The room was very stuffy and airless and it was way to noisy to have the window open. After speaking to several staff I was eventually told that the air condition was switched off at the mains and they were not going to switch it back on. Very disappointing as the road works started at 7am so no lie ins for us! I wouldn't really recommend this hotel unless you are getting a serious bargin and you are not too bothered about luxury! If you do end up here, there are some really nice restaurants and bars around the block from the hotel so don't immedialty head for the tourist areas to eat or drink as you might miss out and spend far more than you need to. Overall good stay in Rome but could have done better in hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a revamp”
Reviews.Author: LouLouWicklow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights in total on a recent to Rome, we found the location great but the hotel needs updating, it starting to show its age. Our room was smelling of old smoke and we had one of the best rooms we were told. At first we felt it was good value on booking, but the cost of the drinks in the bar, the ironing services as there is no iron in the room, the internet fee they charge, you begin to feel its about how much they can make once you are in the hotel! Some of the staff were very helpful to us in suggesting places to eat, etc.

Reviews.Title: “accessible comfort.”
Reviews.Author: Isawtheelephant
Reviews.Content: Rome is notoriously expensive, but this time we struck lucky. A city centre location with immaculate bedroom and bathroom and a fabulous breakfast with truly considerate restaurant staff. I accompanied my husband on a business trip and the location is perfect for walking to the Spanish Steps and Villa Borghese... if you are wearing walking shoes, of course. The Metro is handy with the nearest stop just at the bottom of Via Veneto and the rest of Rome a few minutes away. I would recommend this hotel for its quiet elegance. We booked with last minute .com and the receptionist pointed out that this time last year it would have cost us 3 times what we paid. Although we didn't use the restaurant in the evening, the roof top venue must be a charming spot with its wrap around terrace and the lights of Rome spread out beneath you. We did manage to have our breakfast outside on the terrace one morning and the waiters happily plied us with cappucinos and esspressos as we gorged ourselves on the lovely breakfast buffet. Although it has no outside space, this is a city centre, there is so much to do in Rome that I didn't notice. Have a browse around the fabric shop as you walk towards the Via Veneto..... I'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't recommend”
Reviews.Author: DeniseWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Romanico Palace for 3 nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We booked a suite with whirlpool bath hoping for something special! We even contacted the hotel a few days before we travelled to make sure we had a whirlpool bath because of some of the previous negative reviews. We got an email straight back confirming yes definately a room with whirlpool bath excellent we thought! We were 5 hours delayed in the Uk due to Italian Air Traffic Control strike so instead of arriving Fri lunchtime as planned we arrived at rush hour Fri evening but never mind we thought we'll check in and have a lovely bubbly bath. The man on reception said oh we have our best suite for you its a lovely room! We were a little shocked to be shown to quite a small room it had a tiny balcony no wardrobes or drawers it was clean though. Popped the bath on relieved to finally be in Rome to find out the whirlpool bath was not working!!! They sent someone up to have a look but the man that needed to look was fixing the boiler as there was no hot water!!!!! Perfect end to a not so perfect day. We complained again in the morning and were told it would be fixed it wasn't! Every person on the desk told us something different we got the impression that they clearly knew that bath wasn't working and frankly never was going to be anytime soon. One member of staff offtered us a room change to a better room and promised we could take a look when we came back later that day, then with different member of staff on he shook his head and said that was not possible. At this point we were fed up of asking they offered us 50 euros discount we eventually settled for 150 euros! The room rates they have up on reception are a total joke I cannot believe anybody has ever paid 1200 euros a night for our room I think they should take it down its just ridiculous. In general breakfast was ok nice sat up on the roof terrace but you have to pay extra if you want any eggs. Not in a bad position to get around Rome thought past many hotels on our way to the Metro that I think would have been nicer. The bar on an evening is just at the side of reception with no atmosphere I don't understand why they don't use the roof terrace which would be nice at night. Also really sorry to still be moaning but as previous people have said from 7am tables and chairs are dragged across the floor on the roof terrace which was just above our room and you have to hear it to believe it. Rome itself was a fantastic place we really enjoyed it and found getting around on the Metro really easy and cheap will be going back but try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: n_ackrill
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending our honeymoon in Rome and spent 5 nights in the Romanico Palace Hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff were so friendly from the moment we walked into the hotel, they made dinner reservations for us on several nights and nothing seemed too much trouble. We had a deluxe room and had both a jacuzzi bath and shower with massage jets. The decor is gorgeous throughout the hotel. Breakfast is fabulous with amazing views from their roof-top terrace, although it was a shame that dinner couldn't be eaten up there. We enjoyed a glass of prosecco in the hotel bar on a few occasions at a very reasonable price, infact cheaper than most hotel bars we visited in the area. The hotel has a great location although it was a little further from the spanish steps than we orginially thought, but the trevvi fountain and termini are both only about 15 mins away. We would recommend this hotel to anyone, although we probably wouldn't have paid the room prices had we not found this hotel on lastminute.com. Thank you to all the staff at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel With A 'Tude”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaG7
Reviews.Content: 6 of us with a small group tour had reservations for 3 nites including breakfast. The front desk staff was so unfriendly, surly even, whenever we requested anything. Located near the embassy area, we felt perhaps American tourists were not their first choice. Rooms were petite but breakfast was fabulous so I only gave this a poor. Use only if you have advance notice they are not nice. Location was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad- but no 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: dee2000x
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights last week. On reading the reviews I was worried the room wouldn't be nice so I paid for an upgrade to a deluxe room. Just as well, the room was ok size (due to having 2 beds, we only needed one) I can't imagine what the classic room was like. We weren't that bothered as we spend most of our time out sightseeing. While the room was perfectly clean, there were marks on the walls. The hotel website is a little misleading as although our room was perfectly fine, it wasn't what I would classify as luxurious or plush. On the positive side - the staff were lovely, the breakfast was lovely, I liked the quirky decor of the hotel, the location is perfect, you can easily access all the sights. For some reason the temperature of the aircon was centrally controlled, so we were too hot at night. I can't imagine anybody paying the rack rates advertised - if you want to spend that kind of money go to one of the big hotels on Via Veneto! Overall it is an ok hotel in a good location, using booking websites you can get ok deals on the price.

Reviews.Title: “Better than it sounds”
Reviews.Author: EssunCee
Reviews.Content: Booked a trip via LM.C and this hotel was on offer. Was initially put off by some reviews but went for it and very pleased I did. It was a bit difficult to find in the dark coming from station but received a very warm welcome. Nice clean place with excellent room albeit slightly small (but who wants to spend much time in a room when in Rome!). It doesn't take long to walk to nearest metro but go a few minutes more and you are at Spanish Steps or Trevi Fountain. Rome is well expensive even when exchange rate better than it is at the moment but overflowing with history and culture. We had a lovely stay and that includes the hotel and its excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: inneska
Reviews.Content: this was a superb hotel with east access to all the major sites. The staff were very friendly and the room service was excellent

Reviews.Title: “no wow factor”
Reviews.Author: finnmcool9
Reviews.Content: stayed here recently,hotel nice,staff friendly,esp.witers and porters.stayed in a suite but only a room (very nice) with en suite toilet and shower,didnt get any fancy jaccuzi type bath that i kept reading about,no bath at all.I cant imagine anyone paying full price of 1160 euros per night and being delighted. especially as the lift shaft is 1 metre from your bed. also if you are on sixth floor as we were dont expect to sleep after 06.50 as tables and chairs start to get moved on the terrace right above you. breakfast nice but if you want eggs and orange juice it will cost you an extra 10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “We booked for the Romanico Palace but got Veneto Palace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKMarie
Reviews.Content: The reason I was disappointed with this hotel is because we didn’t get to stay in it! From the previous reviews I had read I understand that this is not unusual practice. We arrived early and were told that we could not check in until 2pm, we were expecting this so left our bags, took a map and went exploring. When we returned at about 3.30pm we were officially checked in. This was the point where we were given information on the location of the hotel and advice on how to get around the city, this was a bit late, what did they think that we’d been doing for the last 5 hours?? They informed us at check in that we would not be staying in the Romanico Palace but at their sister hotel next door (Veneto Palace), I was already disappointed as I had read the reviews and understood this to be a poor relation. We were lead to our room by a very pleasant bell boy through a small corridor linking the hotels. We were informed that breakfast was in the Romanico Palace and so had to come back through this corridor to get the lift to the roof terrace every morning. Breakfast was very nice, fruit, cereal, bread, meats, cheese, croissants and cakes. There is nothing else that I can add on the hotel as I would be reviewing the Veneto. However when it came to leaving we went to the reception desk in the Romanico to book an airport transfer, they took all our details and asked for our room number which we had to explain was in the Veneto hotel (as we did every morning at breakfast). We were then told to go to the reception desk at the Veneto hotel to book this!! Fortunately another staff member stepped in and they booked it for us. If I had wanted to stay at the Veneto Palace I would have booked this hotel myself, it has a cheaper tariff so I feel like we have been let down by the Romanico Palace. However we loved visiting Rome and had a great trip overall. We would strongly recommend a trip to Rome, it’s an amazing city, but be aware that if you book this hotel you may not get a room in it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to get back!”
Reviews.Author: happyholidayerx
Reviews.Content: Thought the website photos were wonderful, worried that the hotel would not live up to the expectations, but it exceeded them by far. Beautifully decorated, all rooms were extravagantly decorated in true traditional italian style, lots of space, luxurious bathroom with whirlpool bath. The most special thing is breakfast, wow sitting on the roof terrace was outstanding, freshly made coffee, handsome waiters, fresh food along with the morning sunshine was so romantic. About 10 / 15 minutes saunter to the spanish steps, I walk slowly!! Great staff, great bar for the evening and the hotel catered for all 17 of our group who were on a photography trip easily. We are organising another photo trip next year and will not hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: PackMax
Reviews.Content: We were early for check in so baggage was quickly put into storage. We stayed for 3 nights in a small but neat room with comfortable twin beds and crisp, fresh linens. In the lobby, at what turned out to be a concierige desk, was a most charming and helpful lady with a beautiful name, Ilaria. Be sure to see her if you go. Her recommendations for activities and eateries....perfect. The hotel accommodated a late leaving by once again storing our bags. Not a luxury hotel but a well located, more than adequate place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast In Style & Friendlyness”
Reviews.Author: Stewz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 week. Very comfortable and friendly. Great rooftop breakfast with amazing views across Rome. Close to the USA Embassy and in a better part of town but reasonably quiet considering you are as central as you need to be. The Vatican was a 50 minute walk from the hotel with the Colloseum being about 40 minutes. Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps all close by. Meals in the resturaunts were expensive and it was difficult to find somewhere that didn't rip you off. Expect to pay 90 euros for a meal for 2 and one glass of wine and this is likely to be a pasta based dinner the sort of thing I would consider a cheap and a quick meal back home. There was a water pipe noise in our room which I comp-lained about but it did not get fixed and the hair dryer did not work for which they seemed not to have a spare however it was fixed the next day. I would rate the hotel 9 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Everything good but disapointing room”
Reviews.Author: mariaspain
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel early September. We chose it because of the good reviews and a pretty decent last minute offer! (considering the room rate advertised in the hotel is 1000 euros per night!) The web pictures looked lovely (the reception are is nice) We walked to it from the train station. Just a 15-20 min walk but not recommended carrying cases and with quite high temperatures... we took a taxi in the way back. The location is very good, pretty much opposite the American Embassy, so there are carabiniery in standby all the time. Within 30 min walking distance to Spanish steps, other attractions and the metro stop. Lots of places in the area to eat. The staff were extremely helpful. Special mention to Andre (and the other porters who helped us) and Alesio from reception, whose languages knowledge and proffessionalism was of note! He also gave us a great restaurant recommendation for lunch nearby the hotel (La Lambada, take left outside the hotel and then the 1st right). This was a very roman restaurant, not turisty at all... were the menu was in english but it was the best most real italian food we tasted in our 2 week tour of Italy. Lots of workers from the area eat there. The downside was that the room, while spatious (except the bathroom) was very old (with cracks in the walls). The bathroom was an experience as it was very narrow and there was no door (great power shower though! It was a blessing after the roman heat!). Also good air conditioning with room controls. Considering we paid over 100 euros a night and we probably got the worst room in the hotel, we would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Suspect”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledfamdam
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is quite good, not great (Central is better for travelers). Rooms are clean with stone tile floors. The breakfast is a nice touch on the roof and convenient before exploring for the day. While the star system rates this hotel a four I would give it more like a 3-3.5. The staff is friendly and helpful. The lobby is nice to relax in and have a bottle of wine to complete the day. I am a bit suspect with all these great reviews here, and the management responding to each one. I couldn't help to notice one comment mentioning the great dinner reservations the hotel can make for you. I took this recommendation and reservations at a cost. The hotel sent me to one of the most expensive restaurants I've ever been to. Spagetti was 29 Euros for a small plate of medeocre spagetti and the great laugh of the night was 4 inches of Sausage for 30+ Euros. Upon entering the host asked where we were staying. It didn't hit me until later the hotel and /or personel are probably getting kick-backs to make these recommendations. The dinner was absolutely horrible. Note: Always refer to a reputable guide for dinner. I used a lonely planet guide another night and spent 1/6th of the amount for a fantastic dinner. Be very careful to take any recommendations from anyone let alone the hotel you are staying at. If you see exhorbitantly high prices in a restaurant, get out quickly. Another very odd thing about the hotel was the posted room rates. The lowest posted room rate was 900+ Euros at the counter. Everyone knows the room rates are not this high. It seems the management is trying to make everyone feel they got a great deal at sub $200 Price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: acgwinn
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Attentive staff. Great breakfast on the terrace on top of the hotel. WONDERFUL VIEWS. Convienent location. Our room was very nice. We booked the Junior Suit for 120 Euro a night. It was lovely and large with a terrace and hot tub! A bottle of spumante came with it. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Romanico Palace was great!”
Reviews.Author: pilotcurler
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with Hotel Romanico Palace, 37 Boncompagni, in Rome, Italy. We stayed four days in a triple room (king and a daybed for 11 year old child) which were all very comfortable for our first vacation visit to Rome. The best features -- (1) location -- walking distance to Spanish steps and shopping, Roma Termini, restaurants (2) the rooftop breakfast -- good view every morning across the rooftops, (3) the staff -- to a person, very helpful and friendly, and even some English to help me through what little Italian I have ever learned. Allessio at the front desk deserves a special mention -- very gracious. We would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Kitsch...Tried to Pull a Fast One...Main Hotel Just Okay...”
Reviews.Author: Team_K_2009
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1am after a delayed flight. We had prepaid for the hotel through lastminute.com and were looking forward to a good night's sleep. Hotel looked nice on website and was 4 stars. However, without telling us otherwise, staff put us into the attached 3 star Venetian Hotel, which was disgusting. The hotel room looked as though it was used for immoral purposes - it was unclean, old, and just plain gross. My husband went to complain, and they told him to come back in the morning. Apparently, others had had this problem as well. In the morning we were moved into a room in the hotel that we did actually book. It was much cleaner and more comfortable. Still just okay, as it was outdated, the beds were okay but not great, and the bathroom was very small. Staff were friendly, however, and the location was good. Hotel decor was OTT gaudy, but I guess that that adds some character as well...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great”
Reviews.Author: NJCiccio
Reviews.Content: After checking in we were told that our room was only available for two of the three nights and therefore if we did not want to change rooms we would have to take a room at the Veneto Hotel, which is pretty much the same hotel but managed separately. The room was the same and we accepted the change. We then had to change rooms again after the A/C in our room was broken and they couldn't fix it. The place is decorated very nicely and it is very clean. The reception staff was helpful and very pleasant. The breakfast on the rooftop was decent but often crowded and understaffed, they were often overwhelmed, but the service was good. Overall it is a clean and nice hotel in a good neighborhood (Very Safe and upscale area), however if you are going to do a lot of site seeing I would recommend something closer to the center as this is a few blocks from Via Veneto and Piazza Barberini but far from everything else. I've been to Rome many times and stayed in less expensive places that were more conveniently located and overall higher quality.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jsm101
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel in May. We arrived at about 13.30 and were told we could not check in until 14.00 by a very rude receptionist. We went for a coffee, came back at 14.00 and there were another 4 or 5 parties waiting to check in. We then had to wait until 14.40 to actually get our room. We were sent to a room in the hotel next door, which the receptionist claimed to be the same hotel, but all the branding stated it was 3* not 4*. The rude receptionist refused to change our room. The room was nothing like what we expected from the hotel website and I thought it was quite tacky in the style of decor and I felt very overcharged. In addition in the morning, we found that the bathroom had flooded and there was water all over the bathroom floor. This was mopped up by a porter and the water turned off, which meant that we were unable to shower before we checked out. I would have expected financial compensation for all the problems we experienced during the stay but we were given nothing. A disasterous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: Oxonianpete
Reviews.Content: The whole family were truly impressed with everything about the Romanico Palace during our stay in July. If you want a spotlessly clean room and bathroom facilities, comfortable bed, attentive service from Ilaria and all the management and staff and a brilliant breakfast on the wonderful roof terrace with great views of the city then just come and stay here. You will love every minute in superb surroundings in beautiful Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Rome enhanced by wonderful hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Irlandadayton_OH
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Romanico Palace. The staff were exceptionally welcoming and helpful, especially Iliana. We had a large double with great Jacuzzi/shower: the room was spotless with towels etc. changed daily,. We appreciated the airconditioning in August, also the quietness of the area at night as well as the alfresco breakfast on the roof each morning. Wonderful location, just off the Via Veneto,( try an afternoon drink at the Cafe de Paris, expensive but work the experince) close to Spanish Steps, Piazza Dells Republica etc. Ask for a room in the main ( Romanico) part, it's more convenient than those in the connected Veneto section.. We would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrenne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Romanico Palace Hotel in Rome for 3 nts in late July 2009. I had found the hotel online and read mixed reveiws. During my hotel search I kept coming back to this hotel as the rooms shown had a very roman feel to them with fresco's on the ceiling, ornate furniture & mirrors and beautifully painted walls. It also said it had a rooftop terrace resturant for the included breakfast. I booked two rooms for our family of four (2 teenagers) and hoped for the best as I know a 4 star hotel in europe is not the same as in the USA. Upon our early morning arrival the rooms were not available yet as I excepted but they showed us to the bathrooms to freshen up and checked our luggage and we were off for sightseeing. Upon our arrival back at the hotel around 5:00pm, we checked in and went up to our rooms. The kids rooms had one double bed so the hotel promtly moved them into another room with twin beds. Upon entering our rooms it was just like the pictures I saw online but better! Fresco on the ceiling, beautiful room, smaller then we're used too but not bad and the bathroom was huge with a shower with 6 jets, handheld and an overhead "rainfall" head. The front desk personnel was helpful. Nice lobby bar w/ reasonable priced drinks and espresso. Nice location just off Via Veneto, and not far from most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic service worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Mo_Lunat
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a weekend break for my sister and her husband to celebrate there 25th wedding anniversary. The Hotel Romanico was fantastic, they had a fabulous deluxe room. There was everything you would expect; good air conditioning, safe, mini bar, hairdryer, satelite TV. The location was perfect, walking distance to the Trevi fountain and the Spanish Steps. The roof terrace was manificent and has a great view over looking Rome. The staff are magnificient and the customer service team and polite and respond to emails ASAP and they remain professional at all times, and take serious any concerns you may have and deal with all enquiries promptly. I had spoken to my sister the day after she arrived in Rome and she was a bit upset about certain matters, which I emailed the hotel with and they acted on this as soon as my sister and husband had returned to the hotel. I thoroughly recommend this hotel to any person who is going to Rome. I my self will be going to Rome very soon and would be booking in to the same hotel. Thank you very much to all staff of Hotel Romanico, for the service you provided.

Reviews.Title: “It's all good”
Reviews.Author: moving8
Reviews.Content: My family (husband and kids aged 14, 12 and 7) stayed here for 4 days in June. We didn't meet the famed Ilaria Lucani, but the gentlemen at the front desk did a lovely job in her place. We stayed in two rooms - one at the front of the hotel and one at the back. Best of both worlds. There were definitely other families staying, but I don't think any of us bothered the non-family groups. We loved the breakfasts and the views from the terrace, and appreciated the help from the front desk in learning how to use the bus system (highly recommend everyone do this). There were definitely a few problems - the phone in one room didn't work, there was a poorly hung shower curtain that let water run everywhere, etc., etc. But all in all, a great experience. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: DevonSnapper
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Rome many times and I have not found a better hotel. The staff and location are superb. Breakfast on the roof terrace is very special, great food and great views. I took a party of 17 photographers in March 2009 and the whole trip was fantastic but the hotel was a real delight

Reviews.Title: “beware of the noise on the street below”
Reviews.Author: reba07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Romanico Palace for 3 days at the end of May 2009. The room was beautiful but quit esmall. The rooftop bar was very nice but the price of the drinks were very very expensive! The biggest problem was the noise below our room. What ever you do request a room that is not on Via Boncompagni. The noise starts with the street vendors at about 6am and does not stop all night with the traffic. Needless to say we did not sleep much while at that Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Fantastic. Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: RAFFA
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a warm welcome By Francesco & Iliara and we were shown to our beautifull room. Upon arrival, we explained to the staff on duty that our airline had lost our luggage & we were booked to go on a 10 day cruise 2 days later. Without hesitation or prompting they immediately called the airline. The airline staff did not seem to be too bothered. Benedetta was on duty the next day and also gave us a very warm welcome. She immediately continued to call the airport to search for our luggage. I have no doubt that it is only due to Benedetta & illiara's continued efforts that our luggage was finally traced & delivered to our hotel 48 hours later. Francesco waited past his shift time to await delivery of our luggage which was delivered around 11:00pm - upon our return from dinner he informed us that he had delivered the suitcases to our room. A huge thank you to these staff members for their effort and help. The hotel was very comfortable & clean, the breakfast was more than adequate. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again. I highly recommend this hotel for value and service excellence. Our warmest thank you and greetings from Raphael & Martine

Reviews.Title: “The Best European Hotel We have Ever Been”
Reviews.Author: rmol1257
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 10 day stay at Romanico Palace Hotel and we must say the experience we had with them was fantastic. The location was not bad, It was walking distance to the Spanish Steps and the Metro. The firmatas (bus stops) were very close to the hotel as well as the termini. The hotel personnel were all wonderful and helpful esp. Ilaria. Please do not hesitate to ask for her as she is very helpful and will try her best to assist you in every way she can. The buffet breakfast at the roof terrace is great with a nice view of the city. You are guaranteed to be energized to face another day of lesiure after eating. We are looking forward to staying at the same hotel on our next visit and this is a place we will recommend to our friends. Thanks again to all the personnel esp. to Ilaria.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: PattiUk
Reviews.Content: I too was worried when I read the reviews of the hotel, but as we booked a great deal through the hotels own website so we thought we'd take a chance. Things did start off a bit rocky, our package included pick up from the airport and I couldn't find the driver, but it all got sorted in the end. The hotel was beautiful, in a lovely area, 15 min walk to the trevi fountain/spanish steps. Our room 619 was fantastic, jacuzzi with doors opening onto the balcony. I loved the breakfast on the roof terrace. I always found the staff very nice, we asked to bring our transport to the airport forward and it was sorted out within 10mins. As part of our package the hotel booked a candle lite meal with a restaurant round the corner (Marinio's I think it was called?!?!) The meal was fantastic, 3 courses, glass of sparkling wine, glass of white wine and an after dinner liquer. We were so full we had to share the 3rd course (the main meal)!!! The service was excellent there as well.

Reviews.Title: “They did a terrific job in making our stay comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Schoolteacher_9
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day stay in Rome at the Romanico Palace Hotel. This hotel is located in a great central location. Every sight we wanted to visit was a short subway ride away. The morning breakfast on the roof terrace was very nice and well stocked. The Romanico is located on a busy street and there is some road noise - but our room was on the sixth floor and we were not bothered by the noise as I heard some guest say they were. We were so pleasantly surprised by the staff's courtesy and interest in making our vacation go smoothly. From recommending a great restaturant to a manicurist, they responded well to every request. One word of caution - be sure to go with one of their larger rooms as the "standard" isn't going to satisfy many travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money- website misleading”
Reviews.Author: LellieLaois
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the romanico hotel for our honeymoon and as it was one of the most expensive hotels on our trip we expected a certain standard. We had also mentioned we were honeymooners and no effort was made by the hotel to acknowledge it. Every other hotel did. From the website, we expected a spacious room with a large jacuzzi. On arrival, the room was small with a jetted bath for a jacuzzi. The first time we used the jacuzzi, the jets pumped dirt into the bath. It is only about a fifteen minute walk to the city centre, so the location is good. Breakfast is also good. It's just not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Room, and Service”
Reviews.Author: Thonie
Reviews.Content: My husband visited Rome for the first time and chose the Romanico Palace, in spite of some of reviews on this website. We booked through American Express Travel, getting a Double Prestige Room with a Jacuzzi tub overlooking the city. The room was beautifully decorated in classical Italian ornate gold and blue (Room 614). The bathroom was awesome. We loved the gold marble, big towels, glass shower, water pressure, the overall look and comfort. The location is excellent and very convenient. We felt very safe walking around at any time of day because the US Embassy is one block away. There were Polizia everywhere, some carrying Uzzi's! The hotel is a couple of blocks from some great shopping. We were also very close to some of the tours we signed up for through Viator.com. The hotel staff were very helpful, making dinner and taxi reservations for us. The terrace patio was beautiful and open for complimentary and delicious breakfast and happy hour. The terrace service for breakfast was top notch; the terrace service during happy hour was slow, perhaps understaffed. It would have been great if the hotel would offer lunch & dinner, but we did not have any trouble finding great little eating spots. Since we were on the top floor, the moving of the chairs on the terrace woke me up in the morning. Lastly, my husband was happy that the hotel offered Wi-Fi. It was the fastest Internet connection he has ever received. Though as our trip progressed, we realized that all Wi-Fi in Italy is faster than in the US. Our experience with the Romanico Palace was fantastic and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a lovely city.”
Reviews.Author: heather048
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in the romanico palace for 3 nights and throughly enjoyed our stay. We had buffet breakfast which was very nice except for the toaster didnt really toast the bread! Cleanliness was to a very high standard as was the service, bags were taken to our room and the room was cleaned every day. The only thing we were not happy about was the fact that the cleaner was interfering with our belongings, ie playing on my DS and not even putting it back! The other thing was that my partner had coffee and I had my own herbal tea bag and we got charged 3 euros for hot water! and we were not even told about it. Mini bar didnt have a price list either which put us off having anyting. There is a terrace on the top floor which is open 6.30-9pm which was a little dissapointing as it was so nice we would have liked to go up during the day as well. Location was pretty good if you dont mind walking, very close to restaurants and bars and about 25min walk to the main shopping part of rome. Overall we liked the hotel and we would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “The most disappointing part of our Italian holiday!”
Reviews.Author: valadin
Reviews.Content: We already spent several nights in Venice and Florence, so we had a level of expectation when it comes to hotel quality and customer service. This was easily the worst hotel I've had the misfortune of visiting. The front desk staff was very cold and slightly disrespectful. The waiter/host of the breakfast room was quite condescending and insulting to us. The concierge was quite rude when I asked him where the nearest "supermercado" was. He told me that it was May 1st and that most businesses were closed. As a native European, I already knew this, but I also knew that the supermercado would be open the next day, as like a fool, I though that the concierge would be helpful... Don't ever stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: amz988
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this just under a year ago but to my disappointment my review was never posted first time round but i just had to leave a comment. I stayed here for a week with my partner and we loved it, it was pretty easy to find and when we got there all the staff were very welcoming and although the room wasn't ready we were given a map of the city and told where a couple of nice places were. When we did eventually check in we were taken to our room, which was very nice and clean. Our towels were replaced everyday and we had no faults with the room or noise at all. The breakfast room up on the roof terrace is amazing and going up there to watch the sunset was very romantic! The hotel is also in a very nice area, not too far from everything you need and good transport links. It is opposite what looks like the american embassy and they dont just put them anywhere so it must have been a very posh area! If i ever return to Rome i would almost certainly stay here again, we loved every moment of this beautiful city and the hotel just topped it off nicely! friendly staff, good location, clean rooms, what more could you ask for??

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, but management needs to re-think their employee choices.”
Reviews.Author: faby99
Reviews.Content: As a first time visitor to Rome, you can imagine how excited I was to be there. I had already stayed a week in Milan and had a great experience at the hotel. When I arrived, the gentleman behind the front desk told me the room wasn't ready and wouldn't be ready till 2pm, no problem, I knew I was early. At 1:45pm, I noticed he began to register guests, so I went up to the desk thinking he would be able to register me, but his response was " Ma'm, I told you rooms wouldn't be available until 2pm, go back and wait", not in a friendly tone, but in a real condescending and annoyed tone. Every night that we wanted a drink from the bar, we were greeted by another annoyed male employee that looked as if he did not want to be there. On the 2nd to the last day, I finished my breakfast, on the lovely terrace and decided to take a cup of coffee down to my room while I got ready for the day. As I was waiting for the elevator, the same evening bartender, rudely told me "no drinks, you need to drink on the breakfast floor", not only was he rude, but continued to scold me as if I was a child and waived his hand at me, indicating that I needed to go back on the terrace. The hotel is very nicely decorated, clean, not close to anything and has to either re-train their staff on customer service or hire an entire new team, in order for them to continue to attract clients. As a professional, that has worked in the customer service industry for 10+ years, I understand mistakes do happen, but there is always a rude way and a polite way of explaining errors to clients. I truly was appalled that they would have such a rude staff, considering it's a 4 star hotel and they are in the hospitality industry. I would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone, until the hotel is able to re-think their employee customer service skills. On a positive note, there was one breakfast waiter, that was very nice and always greeted you with a smile. His co-workers, should really learn something from him.

Reviews.Title: “There must be a lot of better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: FritzCooper
Reviews.Content: The front desk is cold and always seem to b dissaproving. Iliana is very nice but the rest of the staff is dismal

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Jeff4599
Reviews.Content: First of all I can confirm what other reviews have said about Ilaria Lucani who was a great help from the moment we made our booking. Ilaria organised pick up from Fiumiciino airport which was quick, convenient and efficient; made restaurant reservations for us and recommended a restaurant where the staff were friendly and the food excellent. Ilaria's colleagues were very welcoming when we arrived and helpful throughout our stay. The Romanico Palace is in a good location just a short walk from the Via Veneto and the Spanish Steps. We loved having breakfast on the 7th floor Roof terrace and will certainly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: WP&PJW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Romanico Palace for four nights in mid-April, and would happily recommend it to anybody. Consumer websites such as this tend to attract comments from a dissatisfied minority with an axe to grind, rather than the satisfied majority; to help redress the balance, we would readily refute the more negative comments posted. The hotel is a mid-sized corner property in a safe, salubrious location to the NE of the Centro Storico, close to the Via Veneto and south of the Villa Borghese. We found the staff without exception to be courteous and efficient - they were most helpful to me in resolving a problem not of their making (Alitalia had managed to lose my suitcase!). The public areas are bright and opulent, and the decor traditional but striking, with antiques (or repros) dotted around, much gold paint and pillar-box red carpets in the corridors - not perhaps the kind of thing you'd choose at home, but fun for a short time away! The rooms (or at least the recently refurbished 'classic' ones like ours - room 222, since you ask) are of a fair size and spotlessly clean, with 'Roman column' bedposts, marble bathrooms, plenty of lighting and a separate desk area (useful for spreading out maps). No armchair though. Incongrous amongst all the gold and faux-antiquity, a silver LCD TV is mounted on the wall, with BBC World and CNN among the channels. One major word of warning: do NOT take a room facing the street, particularly on a lower floor. They may be sunnier, but the traffic noise is horrendous - something about the noise Italian scooters and buses make in particular just cuts through anything, and it never stops. After one sleepless night we changed to a peaceful room on the same floor overlooking the internal courtyard - not a thing of beauty, but then the street view isn't much either. Breakfast is outstanding - taken on the bright and sunny roof terrace with a view over the city, a sharp contrast to the windowless basement rooms used in so many hotels. Everything one could reasonably expect and more is included on the buffet (including the all-important toaster!), and they'll make you a capuccino on request. Bacon and eggs etc. are available at extra cost for die-hard fry-up fans. Sadly the terrace is only open for breakfast at present. The hotel is well served for public transport: buses 63, 630 and 80 stop right outside, and the dinky little electric 116, which is small enough to negotiate the alleyways of the Centro Storico and goes by most of the major sights, can be caught from the Via Veneto nearby. Individual tickets can be purchased at nearby tabacchi, but to buy a daily pass (4 euros) the nearest place is the Metro station at Piazza Barberini - a pleasant 10-min walk from the hotel down the Via Veneto. So far as getting to and from the hotel and Termini station, avoid the Metro and take bus 910, which stops one street away. We enjoyed our stay, and hope to return. To the staff at the Romanico - grazie di tutto!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel & staff brilliant - Ilaria was fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: arcachon
Reviews.Content: I planned this trip for my husband's 60th birthday and with Ilaria's unstinting help we had the most fantastic 4 days there. Room was superb, roof terrace delightful and maitre d' very helpful and polite. Ilaria booked airport transport, restaurants, hairdresser and tickets for Palm Sunday procession at the Vatican. She manages all guest relations to an extremely high standard and is completely charming. All hotels should have an "Ilaria" !! We will be back and have already recommended to friends and family. Grazie mille per tutto. Maureen Miller

Reviews.Title: “Hotel made our trip perfect”
Reviews.Author: asbManchester
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful weekend in Rome and our hotel was the icing on the cake.We upgraded to a junior suite for a touch of luxury and it was worth every penny.The room had 4 large windows opening onto beautiful views of the City and was large airy and light with amazing furnishings and very comfortable beds.The linen was 1st class and lxurious with soft towels and robes in abundance and a heated towel rail in the lovely bathroom with a jacuzzi .What a treat after a long day sightseeing.The breakfast terrace was a delight and the food was fresh plentiful and varied. The staff were charming polite and helpful and very pleasant at all times. The location was perfect for us, a short stroll to the historic centre yet quiet and peaceful at night. We shall be returning to Rome and we will most certainly stay at this hotel again. It was not Rome on a budjet but we got what we paid for and enjoyed every moment, just wish it could have been longer.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I had hoped it would be!!!”
Reviews.Author: ConnieandSteve209
Reviews.Content: We stayed 12 days here. It was perfect. I admit I was a bit apprehensive after reading some of the other reviews but I loved it. I chose the hotel because of the lovely decor and was not disappointed. The staff were more than helpful, even helping arrange for a Doctors visit to the hotel when my boyfriend was ill. The breakfast was very good with a great variety and I cannot say enough about how great David was serving us every morning. He is a wonderful gift to the hotel. I would recommend the hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even bother - cheap stay for a cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: cos3c
Reviews.Content: -ABOUT THE HOTEL- When we arrived at the hotel the hotel clerk sent us to the hotel next door and they said it was the same hotel but havent changed the name yet. We felt confused and uneasy so we went along with it. The fun stopped when they showed us the room. This was suppose to be a romantic breakaway and the room showed to single beds, condesation on the walls and dirty bathrooms. The hallway even had electrical wires hanging which looked very dangerous. We complained about the state of the room and they said they would move us to the Romanico hotel the next day (the hotel we originally booked). After an uneasy night we were moved to the other room which we supposed to of stayed in the first place. The room was much better and our holiday could begin.. Rome is a beautiful city which made the poor start to our journey dissappear. At the end of the holiday we told the hotel clerk to arrange the same driver that brought us to the hotel which cost us a low 30 Euro's but the hotel clerk obviously did a huge mistake and booked us on a city taxi and cost us 70 Euro's for a trip to the airport. -WHAT TO LOOK OUT FOR- There are many things to see but the most pleasant attraction is St.Peters. I recommend to go to the top and see the most spectacular view you will see in your life - specially at sunset. Try to find a family restaurant to eat and not a tourist trap where they will over charge you. 4 nights is the right amount and gives you enough time to see most attractions. The underground was efficient and is a good means of transport like travelling to the colleseum. When you find the right restaurant with the right atmosphere, the food is simply excellent from pizza's to cabonara's.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it seems!”
Reviews.Author: Dee093
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband travelled to Rome for our first wedding anniversary last year. Having seen the website and reviews for this hotel I decided to book, although it was much mire expensive than a lot of others in the area. When we arrived we were in for a shock to say the least!!! We were taken to our room which seemed to be through a construction site. When we arrived our room was filthy! The room was covered in dust and the bathroom was awful. There were holes in the walls which had been stuffed with newspaper. When I went down to complain I was told that was the room I had booked! It was an awful experience and the only good thing to come out of this was that me and my husbnad spent more time exploring the sites of Rome because we could not bear to stay at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Romanico Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMFManchester
Reviews.Content: Just come back from an amazing time in Rome. The hotel was perfect and in a great location. The room my sister and I stayed in was gorgeous and the bathroom was out of this world. The staff were all lovely and very helpful. Breakfast was great, lots to choose from. Next time I go to Rome I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JordanSofia
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby and restaurant on the last floor with great view,but the room was very small,great location.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 4 star!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheHuffManchester
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the Hotel Romanico Rome to celebrate our wedding anniversary last weekend. When we arrived, it was late, but we understood the hotel had 24 Room Service. The Night Porter told us this was not the case, and we could not even get a hot drink! The corridors were tatty, and carpets dirty. The room was clean, but not what we had expected. There were bare exposed wires hanging out of the wall, and the television did not work. The next morning, which was actually our wedding anniversary, we were woken at 7.10AM with drilling, knocking and banging noises! This went on, and we were in essence driven to vacate our room.So much foir a relaxing morning! We addressed this issue with reception, who merely shrugged! We have been lucky enough to travel extensively, both on buisness, and leisure, and for some years my wife was a Senior Manager for a Large Airline/Travel Firm. This hotel is by no means 4 star, and should not be sold as such. Our romantic wedding anniversary weekend was spolit by the hotel,,and we would not recommend it anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Totally lovely”
Reviews.Author: GazJules
Reviews.Content: 27th sept 08, for 5 nights. We had a lovely stay here, our room was stunning with a wounderful view of the city from our balcony, a totally 4* room. Breakfast and evening drinks on the roof terrace with such a view and sunshine was a great treat, and our friend's from nearby hotel's were made very welcome when they joined us there. Bar the day time building work on one of the floor's and a couple of staff member's having alittle bit of attitude we loved our stay in such a beautiful hotel and city. plus we would stay there again, thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic - vicandrew”
Reviews.Author: vickiandrew
Reviews.Content: My finacee and I stayed at the Romanico in July 08. (Sorry for the delay in writing but felt I had to having read other reviews to try and balance the view of the hotel). Having booked through lastminute.com and then read the reviews off the hotel on trip advisor we where a little bit worried about what we where letting ourselves in for so much so that we phoned the hotel before leaving england to check that all was as booked. Having read how unfriendly the hotel staff can be i was pleasantly surprised by the help they gave me over the phone, reassurring me all was in order. On arrival at the hotel they couldn't have been more true to their word. The room was fantastic, small yes but bigger enough for our needs and the bathroom fantastic with juccizi shower and bath. We where on the back of the hotel so the view from the window was of a courtyard but being on the back we didn't have the noise from the road so had no problem sleeping. In fact the road was far from noisy and wouldn't have bothered us if we had been on the front of the hotel. I do wonder what poeple expect from a city centre hotel. I have stayed in far more expensive hotels in London, LA and New York and got no where near the level of service and comfort afford by the this hotel. Ok maybe phoning ahead before arrival may have helped me I don't know, all I do know is that this was our first expereince of Rome and the hotel provided what was a fantastic and memorable weekend break. The service from the front desk was first class. they couldn't do enough for us, recommending restrauarts for evening meals, to sorting out taxi's and sightseeing events. I find it hard to understand that people found them rude but again everyone has different experiences and for once in our lives it seems that we got lucky. To hear that the hotel is opening a new roof top restuarant which will serve evening meals is great news as it would be nice having spent all day walking around the many sights of rome to be able to come back and unwind with an evening meal and a glass or two of wine on the terrace of the hotel overlooking the eternal city. The terrace at breakfast time was breath taking with views across the city of rome. We loved the city and can't wait to go back and would have no hesitation in stopping in this hotel again. For us the hotel set the tone on a fantasic and memerable weekend break. Thank you PS The lift was like being charlie in the glass elevator!!!

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: dbusson
Reviews.Content: do not stay here we were given a non 4* room aggressive man on recption would not change for 2 days did eventually . wanted 50 euros more but backed down when other customers gathered another one had the same complaint the room was dated moldy wall paper , very very dated furniture , see pictures there are much better hotels local to this one

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kennethb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Romanico palace for 10 days. The hotel was great in all respects. We had a double deluxe room with a jacuzzi which was wonderful after sightseeing for 6 or 7 hours in 30 degree heat. The room was spaciousand very clean. The rooftop restaurant where we had breakfast was wonderful. Sat outside looking over Rome from the 7th floor. It was also open afternoon and evenings as a bar. They are installing new suites, a new restaurant for evening meals and a spa so next year a visit will be even more perfect. within walking distance of many of the sights and the open top tour bus stop is just a few minutes walk away. We can highly recommend this hotel, especially for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Paulrs
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at the hotel with my wife. Bad points: room was very, very small and dark (this was a deluxe double room) overlooking a dismal courtyard. The room decor bore little resemblance to that of the website photos. This was very disappointing as rates are not cheap. Better rooms can be had in the UK at a fraction of the cost. Good points. Food was ok and there was plenty of choice. Linen and towels were changed daily. Bathroom was as per the website photos. Wouldn't stay there again, although Rome was lovely and very hot...

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels in same vicinity”
Reviews.Author: Plum1
Reviews.Content: Booked thru lastminute.com, very pricey. We booked a deluxe double for our anniversary weekend, the room we were shown to was dark, compact, and in poor repair. Skirting boarks hanging off walls were dirty, no tea making facility and only 1 chair. We were not at all happy. I went to reception to question the room and the manager had a really bad attitude and basically said there was nothing wrong with the room and basically tried to ignore the fact that I was still their. I had to remind him that I was the guest and that I was not happy, it did not reflect the deluxe rooms shown on the websit to which he replied was only to get people booking. I hung on and when some new guest were arriving he got the bell boy to show me to another room, which I made quite clear that I wanted to see prior to accepting. My husband was so dissappointed he was prepared to pay for another hotel elsewhere rather than stay in that room, fortunately the other room was lighter and in slightly better decor, still no tea making facility and only one chair, but bigger. Was also dissappointed by the fact that the hotel only provided a facility for breakfast and not dinner, would have been ideal after a days sightseeing to relax at the hotel knowing you did not have another long walk ahead of you to get some food. In hindsight this was probably best given their attitude to everything else. All nourishment of any kind is highly over priced, a bottle of sparkling water in the hotel is 3 euros and only 25 cents in the supermarket less than 100 yards from hotel. If you book this and are not happy I would definately suggest complain, complain, complain.

Reviews.Title: “be careful”
Reviews.Author: skobie90
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my anniversary after looking at lastminute I had researched even phoned last minute and contacted the hotel via email to let them know what I was expecting. When we arrived and were taken to our room My heart sank and my wife was so dissapointed and I was livid. It was truly the worst room I had ever seen in terms of a hotel and this was meant to be four star! dirty carpet, tired wall paper, small oh and did I mention it was small. They did not even have an iron or service that could provide such things. I was assured a top room with free internet service this did not happen. I eventually got some internet service and sent the manager an email to which he replied the following day and after some talking here and there we were upgraded to a much better room actually it was 100 times better which made our stay wonderful. staff are helpful but it depends who you get, In terms of Location it is brilliant it is a stone throw away from the main areas however there were other hotels closer and possibly better. I would go back again if I had the same room or better but more simply because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “It was a good stay”
Reviews.Author: DRGosport
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, if I go back to Italy probably will like a place more in the center of the city. This hotel was well care and we found the room very cute. We have to walk a lot to get to Termini station.

Reviews.Title: “very romanitc”
Reviews.Author: kel1234567
Reviews.Content: After reading a few bad reviews of this hotel I was a bit put off about boooking it. I emailed them and copied some of the comments from other bad reviews into the email. They emailed me back and said they hadn't recieved any complaints at the time and assured me of a good stay. We got back last night after a 3 night stay and it was fantastic. Beautiful room on the 4th floor with a huge bed, the room was deocrated in red and gold with huge windows. Bathroom had a huge shower all decorated in marble. The location was good, within walking distance of the metro and lots of restaurants. Make sure to get the bus from the airporrt to the Metro and then the metro to barberni only 2.20 euros each, better than 45 eruos for a taxi!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here - overpriced and very rude staff at reception”
Reviews.Author: Bootsin
Reviews.Content: Overview: Noisy - on the corner of 2 very busy roads Shabby - even in a suite the toilet door didnt shut and the shower jets flooded the bathroom Staff at reception are rude and unhelpful - I think very used to complaints! Very small rooms even by big city standard If you get the suite with the jacuzzi for a good price then this would be the only stay I would recommend. My husband and I booked our stay at Hotel Romanico palace via last minute.com. It was expensive but looked nice on the website so we thought we would treat ourselves. When we arrived we were shown up to a tiny box room overlooking an ugly internal courtyard which was noisy and dark. I was really upset with the room so we went straight back down to reception and asked to move. There were no road facing rooms available (which was probably a blessing as this hotel is on the corner of a very busy cross road with lots of road noise) so the only alternative was a junior suite. The receptionist told us this was the best room the hotel had to offer. Having seen the room we agreed to an upgrade fee of 80Euros per night ontop of our already high price. The good things about the suite - a very nice jacuzzi bath on a nice balcony. This totally made our stay as it was lovely to spend time out there and the views were very nice. Reasonably well decorated but still looks abit tired. Bad things - you are directly under the breakfast balcony and get woken up every morning at 8am by chairs being scraped across the balcony floor. The road noise is very loud, even at this heigh. The bathroom door doesnt shut and the shower has jets that look nice but if you use them they flood the bathroom. When I tried to tell reception about the things with the room that need fixing he wouldnt even listen to me...just saying 'that is the best room we have!' I would not recommend this hotel. It is a 15 minute walk from Trevi fountain and there are closer hotels within the traffic free zone that would be much nicer. They also will not let you bring any food or drinks into your room even though they do not serve dinner or lunch.

Reviews.Title: “4 star??????????????”
Reviews.Author: jones003
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really disappointing, nowhere near as grand as the website photos! The room was really small with no bath. When we were leaving for the airport the staff informed us that they had lost the key to the luggage room and we had to wait nearly an hour whilst they tried to break the door down. It was more like Fawlty Towers!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: rosiekia
Reviews.Content: When we were shown to our room it was half the size it appeared on the website, there had been a leak and the wallpaper was hanging off the walls in the corner of the bedroom. Where there were grills in the room, presumably air conditioning, there were large black stains on the wallpaper. The bathroom door had holes in all around the door handle and the plaster was coming off the ceiling in the very tiny bathroom as well as large damp stains on the ceiling. We asked to be moved and were told there was nothing available. As I had already prepaid via last minute.com we felt we had no choice other than to stay the night. The hotel did move us in the morning to another basic but clean room. There is continual traffic noise outside the rooms all through the night as the buses keep stopping and pulling away at the traffic lights. The only saving grace is the hotel terrace which is lovely. However, I truly believe that any hotel in Rome would be better than this one!

Reviews.Title: “not as posh as the web site”
Reviews.Author: mgcrew
Reviews.Content: Although the web site shows wonderful pictures of spacious rooms the reality is slightly smaller. The room we had was quite reasonable but the traffic noise in the morning was disturbing. The room was better than we had expected having read all the reviews before going. The breakfast was plentiful and the views from the roof top restaurant were outstanding.The position of the hotel is a little further from the Spanish steps than the 15 minutes stated but the walk to the park was easy and a real delight.I would recommend the bus tours as you can get 48 hours of travel for a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Cant believe some of these reviews!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kayleigh2008
Reviews.Content: In november 2007 my boyfriend took my on a suprise trip to rome.. We stayed in the romanico palace.. As soon as we pulled up at the hotel I loved it!!! The entrance is soo grand... The hallways are lovely... The lift.. Well I know it sounds silly but the lift is amazing!!!!! The rooms are lovely and big.... the bathroom is great too!!! We actually got engaged on our trip to rome and I must say the whole trip was perfect.. Everything from checking in, to giving us maps and directions to looking after our luggage when we had checked out of our room... The only problem I did have was that the hotel didnt have a resturant, you could only have breakfast there but not lunch or dinner, but with so many place in rome it wasnt really an issue... I would go back tomorrow if I could!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Romanico Palace
HotelInfo.Address: Via Boncompagni 37, 00187 Rome, Italy
